result.title: Rewarding%20Past%20Go-Ethereum%20Development%20Efforts
result.plaintext:
This is an inter-chain diplomacy proposal for the Evmos Community to reward the creators and maintainers of the [go-ethereum library](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum) for past development efforts. go-ethereum is used by [Ethermint](https://github.com/evmos/ethermint).

Amount in $EVMOS: TBD in poll. Comment for other amounts.

Distribution: TBD.

## Summary of Facts

- go-ethereum is the de-facto library that implements the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)
- Ethereum core devs are continuously [improving](https://eips.ethereum.org/core) and [refining](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3540) the EVM, which benefits Evmos too.
- currently, 516 chains use EVM: https://github.com/ethereum-lists/chains/tree/master/_data/chains
- as far as I am aware, there are no official proposals from other chains' communities to reward the go-ethereum team for their work (not counting Ethereum itself, of course).
- I understand that the go-ethereum team was included in the initial Evmos rektdrop, but I do not have information about actual numbers or people included, or whether anyone claimed the airdropped tokens.

## What Does Evmos Stand to Gain?

The Evmos Community has the opportunity to lead by example and establish a mode of collaboration between chains based on clearly recognizing the effort and ideas that it uses. This proposal rewards the effort that has made Evmos itself possible.

It is to Evmos's benefit to have a good relationship with the creators and maintainers of the EVM engine. Even if Evmos decides to maintain and develop its own types of EVM(s).

Additionally: Evmos will benefit if Ethereum will accept and adopt its innovations such as:
- the framework for adding precompiles ([Federico's work](https://github.com/evmos/ethermint/pull/1272))
- the framework for stateful precompiles ([my work](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/26119))


## Proposal Lead

I have been volunteering for Ethereum since 2018. My contribution is described in detail [here](https://github.com/loredanacirstea/CV/blob/master/Ethereum.md) - I am an author of EIPs, a functional language for EVM: Taylor, a visual language for EVM: Pipeline, presented at conferences and many other projects in the Ethereum space.

In Evmos, I was elected by vote in the Evmos Interchain Office [Evmos Governance proposal #45](https://www.mintscan.io/evmos/proposals/45) and I have been contributing to Evmos (code, prototypes, innovations, video demos, governance) as a self-funded volunteer from The Laurel Project. Detailed contributions [here](https://evolve.provable.dev/). This proposal is made from a volunteer capacity (independent, self-funded, from the heart).

_Originally written at https://github.com/the-laurel/chain-proposals/blob/main/evmos/RewardingPastGo-EthereumDevelopmentEfforts.md_

topic.name: 3. Community Treasury
topic.description: Governance Proposal to ask for funds from the community treasury

result.title: Evmos Ecosystem Campaign by Galxe
result.plaintext:
Summary

The Galxe team proposes allocating $300K USD in EVMOS to fund targeted campaigns and initiatives that provides Evmos with exposure to new users and drives organic growth on-chain. Leveraging our existing user base and previously successful campaigns, Galxe will guide users through the Evmos ecosystem to complete on and off-chain tasks and reward them with EVMOS tokens for doing so. These campaigns will involve partnerships with current Evmos dapps, and can expand to more other protocols as they launch on Evmos as well. With a large portion of the Rektdrop being clawed back, users who missed out have a chance to engage with the ecosystem. This will bring value to the Evmos community through expanding the user base, and providing outside users with direct exposure to Evmos and its native dapps.

These funds will be sent to a multisig comprised of Evmos community members and the Galxe team to ensure accountability for the distribution of funds. (TBD)

Disclaimer: All funds will only be distributed to the participating Evmos community.

Motivation

Galxe is the leading Web3 credential data network in the world. A collaborative credential infrastructure enabling brands and developers to engage in communities and build robust products in Web3. Galxe’s infrastructure allows dApps to grow their community off chain and their protocol on chain through Galxe’s tools. Think of Galxe as a way to deploy on chain loyalty programs and customized growth marketing campaigns by distributing NFT badges. Up to this point, Galxe has over 11,100+ credentials contributed to its network, worked with over 1,200+ ecosystem partners, produced 8,000+ campaigns, and built up a community of 8.2M+ Galxe ID users. Credentials are a user’s footprint on or off the blockchain that represents their behaviors and actions taken (e.g., follow twitter, retweet, attend an AMA, swapping, staking, farming etc.)

Diffusion, Orbital Apes, and SpaceFi have already agreed to be part of the Evmos Ecosystem Campaign on Galxe. The community can suggest other dapps that are live as well as future projects that launch on Evmos. Simple on-chain and off-chain tasks will be leveraged that will allow for high exposure and a low barrier of entry to the Evmos ecosystem. Potential tasks and credentials can include the following:

Following socials (Twitter/Discord)

Retweet/Quote Tweet a specific tweet

Make a swap

Provide liquidity

Buy an NFT and hold for X amount of time

The goal of this initiative is to drive off chain and on chain growth to the Evmos ecosystem

Introduce the Galxe community of 8.2M+ active wallet addresses to the Evmos ecosystem

Introduce the broader crypto ecosystem to the Evmos ecosystem through Galxe’s tools and co-marketing powerJoint AMA’s

Blog post

Retweets

Quote Tweets

Tweets all throughout the campaign

Discord/Telegram communication

Campaign featured on our main carousel [see: https://galxe.com/campaigns ]

Engage users who aren’t currently in the ecosystem

Educate users on Evmos through learn to earn and participate to earn NFT campaigns

Problems a Galxe campaign addresses

Stagnant growth to the ecosystem

Lack of new users

Absence of engagement

Low exposure

Value that Galxe can add

Drive new, quality users into the ecosystem from a new web3 audience that Evmos has not had exposure to yet

Increase TVL and transaction volume on Evmos for long term growth

Discord and Twitter tools to engage off chain

On chain tools to create on chain loyalty programs

Past experience with similar campaigns that include Arbitrum, Solana, Optimism, and Moonbeam

Bring users from other EVM and non EVM chains to the ecosystem

Convert new users into long term, loyal users of the Evmos ecosystem

Experts in on chain and off chain growth

Strong marketing power and exposure from Galxe’s socials and network

Twitter : 504K+ (Verified)

Discord : 295K +

Co Marketing Galxe can provide:

Joint AMA’s

Blog post

Retweet

Quote Tweet

Tweets all throughout the campaign

Discord/Telegram communication

Campaign featured on our main carousel [see: https://galxe.com/campaigns ]

Overall ask and where the funds will go

Disclaimer: All funds will only be distributed to the participating Evmos community.

The overall ask is for Evmos to put together an ecosystem campaign on Galxe similar to the likes of the Optimism Quest, Solana’s “2022 is gonna be Sol Cool”, Arbitrum Odyssey, and Moonbeam’s Ultimate Harvest Moon Campaign'' all hosted and coordinated by Galxe. The funds allocated to this campaign will go to the community members who participate in this campaign and not to Galxe. A scoring system will be put in place for the users who collect all or the majority of badges throughout the campaign. The more NFTs you collect the more you will be rewarded.

https://galxe.com/polygon/campaign/GCNWwUwJBT

Twitter Space Credential Badges claimed after attending a Twitter Space

https://galxe.com/ZetaChain/campaign/GCcGZUtnHZ

Twitter/Discord Credential 169K+ NFTs Minted

https://galxe.com/HopProtocol/campaign/GCmydUtumN

NFT for bridging ETH over to Arbitrum 240K+ NFTs Minted

https://galxe.com/odos/campaign/GChMBUtwGc

NFTs for swapping into specific tokens with a minimum $USD on ODOS DEX 516K+ NFTs Minted

https://docs.galxe.com/case-studies/DEXGrowthWithHashflow

Hashflow DEX Case Study On chain growth from 3,000 - 13,000+ users in 6 weeks

Trading volume went from $19.8M - $673M in 6 weeks

https://galxe.com/Optimism/campaign/GC6HiUtSAs

Stargate Bridge Campaign in Optimism Quest 60K+ NFTs Minted

About Galxe

In 2021, Galxe was formed by Bullet Labs and has seen substantial growth on numerous fronts. Charles Wayn and Harry Zhang co-founded Galxe and previously founded the blockchain streaming service, DLive, where they successfully exited in 2019 after a sale to BitTorrent.

Since inception, Galxe has raised $10M from top VC funds around the globe, had an oversubscribed public sale on CoinList, and launched the $GAL token in May on the majority of tier 1 CEX’s which included Binance and Coinbase on the first day. Their latest financing round was led by Dragonfly and Multicoin Capital . Most recently, Galxe was awarded the 2022 Binance Launchpool Project of The Year Award.

Galxe has extensive experience in putting together ecosystem campaigns and has delivered superior results for each ecosystem we’ve partnered with. Running an ecosystem campaign on Galxe comes with incredible co-marketing opportunities that include Retweets, Quote Tweets, Tweets all throughout the campaign, Discord/Telegram communication, Joint AMA’s, Blog post, and Campaigns featured on our main carousel.

Previous Ecosystem Campaigns

Solana’s “2022 is Sol Cool” Campaign

Solana’s ecosystem added 33,400 new users with each unique user trying an average of 5 protocols on Solana and 4,826 users completing 10 or more tasks from different partners.

Campaign page views for duration of campaign: 1,233,416

Users (unique visitor for duration of campaign): 336,313

NFT Minted: 130,503

**Blog post by Galxe: **https://blog.galxe.com/project-galaxy-presents-2022-is-gonna-be-sol-cool-6445c43a942c

**Case Study: **https://docs.galxe.com/case-studies/EcosystemGrowthWithSolana

Galxe Blog Post for Solana Campaign: https://blog.galxe.com/project-galaxy-presents-2022-is-gonna-be-sol-cool-6445c43a942c

(image)

Arbitrum Odyssey

Campaign page views until 10/13/2022: 2,256,041

Users (unique visitor): 394,992

NFT Minted 420,401 until pause for Nitro (Arbitrum network upgrade) one week in

Blog post by Galxe: https://blog.galxe.com/project-galaxy-teams-up-for-arbitrum-odyssey-104e07edcdc9

Campaign page: https://galxe.com/arbitrum/campaign/GCCNzUtQiW

Optimism Quest

Campaign page views until 11/08/2022: 1,010,701

Users (unique visitor): 64,938

NFT Minted 553,524 to date

Blog post by Galxe: https://blog.galxe.com/galxe-x-optimism-optimism-quests-f060c139d660

Campaign Page: https://galxe.com/Optimism/campaign/GC6xiUtedg

Stargate transactions after beginning the OP Quest (graphic taken on 9/21)

(image)

(image)

Galxe + OP Twitter Spaces Announcement Tweet

(image)

The Ultimate Harvest Moon Campaign (Moonbeam)

Campaign page views from 7/28 - 8/11: 214,287

Users (unique visitor): 48,376

NFT Minted: 41,567

Campaign is paused because of the Nomad hack on Moonbeam

Blog post by Galxe:

https://blog.galxe.com/the-ultimate-harvest-moon-campaign-97d41c5d2f48

Campaign Page: https://galxe.com/Moonbeam/campaign/GCcg1Ut2hD

Galxe Twitter announcement tweet of Moonbeam campaign

(image)

Funding Request

Disclaimer: All funds will only be distributed to the participating Evmos community.

Galxe is requesting a rewards pool of $300K USD in Evmos that will go entirely to community members. We’re waiving integration fees for this type of campaign but want to make sure the participating community is incentivized and rewarded appropriately. Prior ecosystem campaigns have put forth rewards that have included token airdrop allocation and special governance rights. Solana put forth a rewards pool of $1M USD to participating users and Moonbeam allocated 1.5% of their token supply to this type of campaign. Funds will be handled and distributed by a multisig wallet controlled by the Evmos community throughout this entire process. The community members who take part in the engagements can expect to receive the funds after the campaign is over. The Evmos Community can decide how reward distribution will be handled. After the integration of Evmos into Galxe, any dApp in the Evmos ecosystem will be able to run growth campaigns on Evmos on Galxe for years to come.

The campaign structure would typically be throughout a number of weeks depending on how many dApps participate. The community can always be extended and more dApps can join in. Users will complete simple on-chain and off-chain tasks on each dapp such as Twitter/Discord actions and swapping, farming, staking, bridging, LP, etc. Evmos can choose to pick the participating dApps itself or can allow the community to vote and choose the participating dApps. The campaign can be structured in the two following ways:

Throughout the duration of the campaign users will have the ability to engage with two dApps per week and the following week an additional two dApps will become available for users to engage with. Arbitrum is operating their quest like this and we’ve seen success with this structure.

All dApps part of the quest will be available for users to engage with throughout the duration of the campaign. Optimism is operating their quest like this. This could be useful for DeFi protocols if you want users to stake or provide liquidity for a month or longer

Gaxle has the ability to implement sybil prevention credentials to make sure rewards are not diluted to bots and users with multiple wallets. We currently have the following credentials available

https://galxe.com/credential/207415643290116096

Has at least 30 transactions on Ethereum mainnet after Ethereum Merge

https://galxe.com/credential/187770474584514560

Has at least 10 transaction on Ethereum mainnet

We have the ability to set up credentials that include hold X (.1, .25, .5) amount of ETH on Ethereum

We’re excited to have the opportunity to collaborate with the Evmos community, and leverage our current user base to help with the on-chain growth of the ecosystem. We encourage feedback from the community to ensure we’ve addressed any questions or concerns, so we gain resounding support for this proposal.

Disclaimer: All funds will only be distributed to the participating Evmos community.

topic.name: 3. Community Treasury
topic.description: Governance Proposal to ask for funds from the community treasury

result.title: SubDAO%20Heat-Check%20%2F%20Bridge%20Round%20Request%20-%20Renaissance%20Labs
result.plaintext:
Author

Jung Mu Kim @ov#1111

Introduction

We're showcasing our first dApp on EVMOS here: https://lowkeys.io/

EVMOS is a breakthrough in every way, engineering the most difficult problems with innovative token designs and structured community governance. We are following the foothold to build a new ecosystem of physical assets on EVMOS. To unlock them, we need community-led initiatives to seamlessly connect the assets to the tokens. We are stepping into a new era that brings real world utilities into the tokens and making the analog and digital inseparable.

We introduce on-chain governance for physical asset acquisition, starting with contemporary artworks. The community votes on the piece to acquire and the protocol issues fractionalize Alternative Asset (fALT) tokens to represent equity share of the asset. This is akin to the issuance model of Circle’s USDC and Tether’s USDT, tapping into the real world assets to be used for daily crypto users.

The Road to EVMOS subDAO

We ask the community to think about our integration into EVMOS as subDAO, focusing on Web 2.0 users acquisition and onboarding physical assets into the ecosystem. The ethos for decentralization and the logos "disband-distribute-create" model are what unite us together. We will build the killer dApp as the powerhouse of Cosmos together.

We have been thinking and understanding the nuances with subDAO by talking with the EVMOS team. We envision the chemistry between Olympus DAO and Redacted. Both have their own token and different BMs, but conduct towards the same goal under the OHM's ecosystem. They're intertwined with each other's tokens, so it becomes a trustless bond. This is what we will become with EVMOS. In the past months, we've realized that having the community support is much more reliable and more grounded in the direction we're headed for decentralization.

The proposal we outline here is having accountability and consequences and actually being invested both ways to grow and go beyond with the tokens. Our vision is to streamline the other EVMOS subDAOs to follow our framework when entering in as a subDAO to have a trustless recourse to consequences. Though our token will track the protocol / dApp growth specifically similar to a specific ERC20 token tracks growth of its own protocol rather than the entire L1 economy. If we think the EVMOS economy is undervalued as a whole, we should want to own more EVMOS. If we think people are undervaluing ALT growth specifically, we should increase more exposure to ALT. It's the exact same dynamic of whether we would invest in a specific project or we invest in EVMOS instead. If we think the EVMOS economy as a whole is undervalued, you'd buy more EVMOS. But if we think Renaissance will grow faster than the sum total of the economy, we'll want to own that specific token rather than the EVMOS. It's important to note that the protocol growth accrues value back to EVMOS, not just to one token because we're built upon EVMOS and people have to use EVMOS to use our dApp. The EVMOS ecosystem grows with us growing as separate tokens.

Alignment

EVMOS is particularly interesting in the gas fee split. When Renaissance Labs record the fractionalized shares and transactions on a decentralized ledger, there’s no incentive for us to use a particular network. However, the gas fee split effectively incentivizes us to keep EVMOS as our backbone when on-boarding Web 2 users with a seamless UI / UX. While partaking in the fees, we’re further impelled to develop the ecosystem to increase our asset value.

Let’s look at this from another logical sequence - there are very few ecosystems with growing TVL and users like EVMOS in this market. It’s safe to say that EVMOS has found the product-market fit between the users and the network. We’re particularly excited for the next cycles for new ideas to flow into EVMOS and Cosmos to integrate fALTs as building blocks of the protocols.

HACKAtom 2022 in Seoul was the turning point for Renaissance Labs. We were mesmerized by the intellectual curiosity of the builders and support for us. As a new chain, we need more dApps to increase the utility of EVMOS and attract users to the ecosystem with a killer dApp. We are building the dApps at a pace no one has seen.

Why EVMOS?

When Noi mentioned the gas split during HackATOM, we were shocked. How didn’t anyone think of this? Again, the gas split is a major incentive for us to keep building on EVMOS.

We believe in trade-offs, but there are none here. ETH is great for tapping into liquidity sources, but the transaction finalization speed is not up to the standard of an everyday Web 2.0 user. To onboard Instagram and Tik Tok users, we had to find a network that has an unnoticeable transaction finalization.

Adding on to the second point, the cheap gas fees and fast transactions create a value proposal for our users who want both. Let’s take Solana. Solana has an exceptional user experience capturing both, but no incentive for us to build upon it.

Vision

The problem we see today is that the lack of initiatives to onboard Web 2.0 users to dApps. Most of the apps are focused on the decentralization; hence, the scope of variations and developments can only be subtle when we only have a limited set of building blocks bound by pure decentralization. Tokenized physical assets create a new medium of value transfer on Cosmos.

Why Do Physical or Real-World Assets Matter?

DeFi is mostly stable coins, swaps, lending and derivatives, limited by the number of the building blocks. Real-world asset on-chain increase the number of DeFi lego blocks to grow the market size and the users with higher stability and growth.

The global financial value mostly derives from real world assets. For example, the global real estate market has $360 trillion , and gold has $11 trillion market capitalization. Think about unlocking the values tied with the real world assets on-chain with DeFi incentives. Let’s take USDC for example. The yields from USDC outperformed Aave and Compound in the last year. Another example would be Synthetix - a dApp that offers on-chain exposure to fiat currency, commodities and stocks through synthetic cryptocurrencies, locking up to $3 billion worth of assets in the protocol at its peak.

Taking this notion further, we believe that tokenizing world-class physical assets can be beneficial for a multitude of reasons.

For the artists:

Lowering the barrier of entry for their artwork whilst expanding their consumer base. Rather than one individual owning a valuable asset, multiple people can have partial ownership of the asset for the portion they own whilst maintaining the integrity of the physical asset and the transaction fees introduce a new income stream for the artist. i.e. people would rather own a piece of the Mona Lisa over another one of Da Vinci’s artwork.

Art in its purest form is subjective and difficult to be made proprietary. The global art market was estimated to be worth around US$405 billion in 2021 and rapidly growing, and with the advance in technology, gives rise for more. However, with the use of blockchain technology, fALT tokens can act as underlying assets - much like financial derivatives - and can also verify the authenticity and ownership of the assets.

fALT can also be gamified through token ownership. Artists can impose certain benefits and perks for holding a minimum threshold of <1 fALT, further increasing the value of their collection.

For the consumers:

Like financial derivatives, fALT will bring a wave of new investors to trade in this new asset class. We have already seen the huge success of $GMX and $SNX on Arbitrum and there’s still plenty room to grow given the size of the current derivatives market. Indices, ETFs and vaults are just a few examples of the benefits of fALTs.

Holding <1 fALT can also give consumers access to utilities that are gated from the public, much like how NFT passes/POAPs/tickets are used today. This design is fluid and dynamic and stems from the original collection instead of launching multiple collections.

Why Do We Need Funding?

Contract audit has been the financial hurdle for us. We create large and intricate projects, and the auditing fees come hefty. We will not release until we have audits from accredited professionals. The scope of each milestone in the roadmap requires around $150-200K. We have budgeted the annual budget (re-audit of the existing ones) to $800K / year.

World-class team recruitment for faster execution. We live everyday like HackATOM, but there’s still a lot left on the table. We need reliable team members with great execution speed. The majority of the funding will be sorely used to acquire talent to build on EVMOS.

We deal with world-class physical assets, and this comes with another budget that‘s different from development. We will safeguard the assets in a state-of-the-art facility with insurance. The monitoring of the assets will be fully accessible 24/7 by the community. One can argue this is a more centralized approach, but we have chosen the faster execution and user acquisition, while forgoing negligible amount of decentralization in storage process. (Who can say USDC failed because it has centrality?) Also, the tokens are legally represented as shares of the assets under South Korea’s legislation, not securities. We’ve worked relentlessly to figure this one out, so rest be assured that the fALT holders are legally protected to claim the physical assets, even if Renaissance Labs were to disappear tomorrow.

Summary

Renaissance Labs is requesting the support for the launch on EVMOS and $3 million in EVMOS from the EVMOS community pool to fund, develop and bring physical assets on-chain and onboard Web 2.0 users. For comparison, this is less than the total funding request for Phase 1 of the new Governance Council Workstreams for the 6 months currently proposed, and we have the beta ready. We will be build the core DeFi infrastructure faster and safer than any team in the ecosystem. Please note that EVMOS will NOT be released until we meet the milestones.

To reiterate, the requested EVMOS will be released as we meet each milestone . The team will use these resources to grow our dedicated development team, so we can work toward our commitments and responsibilities necessary to create and maintain a decentralized physical asset storage.

To align both the community’s incentives and bind ourselves to the commitments, we’ll be transferring 10% of the total ALT tokens to the community pool . The EVMOS community can partake in the governance and have the tokens as a guarantee from Renaissance Labs. We’re incentivized to retrieve the ALT for EVMOS tokens back to the community pool and flywheel the ecosystem onboarding for teams like us. We have obligations to our backers and will to EVMOS community once this proposal has passed.

We have a DAO backer, Frax Finance , and an institutional backer, Lyrik Capital . The seed round with the two valued our token at $10M.

The valuation has increase to $30M because we found a product market fit with MVP-0 testing. We currently have a conversion rate of 9.88% from the most minimally viable product with only paid marketing. 36.40% of the users come to checkout an artwork and 12.10% create an account with us (this is huge feat, compared to any other new apps). As a comparable study, Circle raised $9 million in Series A at $90M valuation for Series A and Masterworks raised $110M at $890M valuation for Series A.

(image)

EVMOS from the Community Pool will be returned in Series A or B. However, if the community feels aligned with the direction of the dApp and want to diversify the treasury. We’ll follow the community’s decision.

💡 The 10% of the total ALT tokens will not be diluted, as we have a maximum number of tokens and will only be sold at or above the current valuation, only at the community’s approval. Also, we’re committed to buyback our tokens with EVMOS within the next 4 years.

Alternative (ALT) Token

ALT token is the governance token; it is the base token of all our dApps to come, accruing value as we bringing in more physical assets on-chain and increase usage on the EVMOS ecosystem. We have an innovation in our tokens: buybacks. ALT can only be obtained via airdrops by participating in fALT sales after the launch or purchasing them directly from the protocol. The tokens bought via protocol have a cliff to be obtained at a higher price point if all the tokens available at previous cliff are purchased. Not only that we avert the downside pressure for the token, but also ALT will share the revenues from the sales of the artworks, lending, and indices.

The tokens purchased to participate in the on-chain voting rounds to select the artwork or artist the community wishes to onboard. The voters will have a rated discount on the purchases of that round. Also, the creator of indices must burn ALT tokens. The design of the protocol is that ALT would be deflationary in supply as the tokens are burned from utilization.

The following is our token distribution:

(image)

Context

Motivation

Renaissance Labs started in late 2021 as an NFT fractionalization protocol. The NFT craze in the last bull cycle drew an interesting picture. Seeing how the NFT investors left the market after the downturn, we can deduce that they weren’t particularly fond of the value proposition of Web 3.0. People came in for the opportunity to make a quick buck in a new and fastest rising asset class. What we found particularly interesting was that NFTs have turned everyday investors into collectors. Unfortunately, most of the NFTs did not have any utility nor the community to survive the market and gradually faded away

NFTs were mirroring the innate desires to collect non-fungible assets, represent its community and derive value. Then, why don’t we bring the investment-grade collectible in the real-world on-chain? This is where we come in. USDC and USDT have shown a proven and centralized issuance model, where a redeemable token representing the actual asset, removes the need for the intermediary, whilst being fast and customizable on-chain.

We’re embracing the same model for physical assets, starting with contemporary artworks. We transparently disclose the information on the location, condition and authenticity with professional curators and appraisers with tens of years of experience. Circle’s fast-growing success was largely based on the transparency over its competitor, USDT, and that’s us.

Fractionalized Alternative Asset (fALT) are the tokenized shares of the physical assets, verified and stored by Renaissance Labs, starting with contemporary art. Each asset is insured and legally protected, so you don’t have to worry about any mishaps.

Creating a killer dApp for Web 2.0 and Web 3.0 users alike is difficult. The product that fits into both categories involve a tint of centralization and a UX journey that’s attractive and fast. There’s not been an initiative to promote the network usage as EVMOS did with the dApp Store. We’ve found a product that facilitates large amounts of transactions, attractive enough for Web 2.0 users accustomed to paid marketing, while sustaining every aspect of DeFi in every vein of the dApp.

Proposer

Renaissance Labs is an entity in South Korea, whose goal is to issue tokens representing shares of the artworks and the largest $ALT holder at start to flywheel the curation process. Renaissance Labs has expertise in building the core infrastructure and scaling dApps for EVMs and EVMOS. We were the first place in 2022 HackATOM - EVMOS Track and the first place in ETHSeoul.

Jung Mu Kim is a Cornell University graduate and the founder of Renaissance DAO - NFT fractionalization protocol. He’s responsible for scaling a team and designing the protocol / tokenomics. He worked at Samsung Electronics as a AI researcher, responsible for developing random walk and product pricing algorithms. After Samsung, Jung had run a marketing agency for 3 years. He’s experienced with financing / budgeting for the team, growing businesses and apps, and running the operations at a global scale.

Sung Rae Kim is a full-stack engineer with 10 years of software development experience. He is responsible for the development of solidity contracts. Working at Toss — the multi-billion startup in South Korea for developing an app loved by everyone — as a full-stack dev and Donable — a donation after service app — as the CTO, he was responsible for architectural design and app development for Web 2 and 3 users. He has a solid solidity background (no pun intended) from contributing in LiquidDAO, KlayCash, HelloChain for the past 3 years.

Jae Hyun Lee is a RISD graduate and CEO of Geomang Creative Studio, an artist agency in South Korea. He’s been an independent painter, creating and curating artworks for major exhibitions. He’s responsible for onboarding artists for Renaissance Labs. He has sourced exclusive works from Eun Jin Kim, Dew Kim and Jeong Ui Yun. Geomagnetic Creative Studio is one of the most wanted gallery and artist agency by contemporary artists.

VasariDAO is an extension of Renaissance Labs that offers deep dives and curations of the artworks and onboarding artists. Deeply grounded by decentralization, the DAO selects an artist to onboard with on-chain voting and releasing their works on-chain as NFTs or fractionalizing them on Renaissance Labs.

Governance Votes

The following items summarize the voting options and what it means for this proposal. All addresses that vote on the proposal might be eligible for a future airdrop.

YES : You approve the proposal statements and distribute the amount of $3M in EVMOS to the multisig address and receive 30,000,000 ALT (10% of the total supply) to the Community Fund treasury. The treasury will allocate the funds to the Renaissance Labs team, leading the core development efforts and supporting the dApp’s go-to-market strategy. It will also lead to core technology maintenance and continuous discussion to ensure the project’s longevity.

NO : The NO vote is a request for improvements or adjustments. You agree that this proposal’s motivation is valuable and that the team should create a follow-up proposal once the amendments are included.

NO (VETO) : You veto the entire motivation for the proposal and expect the core team and current maintainers to make the determination and continue the stewardship of the project. The proposers will not create a follow-up proposal.

ABSTAIN : You are impartial to the outcome of the proposal.

Multisig and release of funds

Upon the approval of the proposal, the treasury will distribute the funds to a ⅔ multi-signature account managed by the following individuals/partners:

Jung Mu Kim - Renaissance Labs (Proposer)

Tricky or LPX - EVMOS

1 Community Member

The account address is: 0x16182E0d7Ba52764A982552DfDdFDe8519feE7DF

If the proposal passes, the team will immediately receive 40% of the funds to expand its engineering team, artwork acquisition team and other business development efforts to support GTM for the dApp. The remaining 60% will be released in an equal proportion to the number of milestones upon the completion of each milestone. For any reason, if the proposer has not completed the next milestone within a year of the last payment, the remaining funds held in the multisig account will be returned to the community pool.

Product commitment

The current proposal aims to develop all the necessary components for a successful tokenization of contemporary artworks. Our team will lead the core development efforts to execute the points below.

Hard Commitments

These are the items that are mandatory for the release of funds. The items will be split into four milestones. We expect to complete all the milestones within the year of launch. Yes, we work fast.

Milestone 1: $ALT and $fALT Launch

This milestone is to distribute $ALT in a launch and flywheel the $fALT distribution with on chain governance to select the desired artworks by the community. The following are the tech specs required:

ALTToken (ERC20): ALT Token native to EVMOS

fALTToken (ERC20)

wfALTToken (ERC20)

fALTSale: Used for the first sales of fALT

ALTDrop: ALT Token air-dropped in accordance to fALT purchase amount

Buyback : Buying back the ALT token at specified price with respective cliff. More details are outlined in the tokenomics.

Vote : On-chain governance on artworks yet to be sourced. If the vote is successful, the voters will receive 10% discount on the offerings.

Liquid-Wrapper : Wrapping ownership-sharing fALT Tokens into liquid wfALTToken. The Korean government dictates that the fALT tokens are actual representation of the underlying asset. Therefore, we designed a whitelisting process for the fALT token to not fall under any third party outside the interest of artwork sales. The liquid-wrapper allows the underlying fALT tokens to remain in the protocol until the artwork sale and the wrapped tokens to trade without governance over the sales.

ALT Airdrop: $ALT will be airdropped to EVMOS holders and fALT purchasers. The ALT drop amount will increase in respect to the amount of fALTs purchased.

ALT Initial Offering: Sale of $ALT tokens with price increase cliffs at the number of tokens sold.

Bridge: Bridge between ETH and EVMOS for ALT, fALT, wfALT.

Documentation: Ensure the documentations for both ALT and fALT contracts are up to date with the implementation. The team will create an in-depth how-to videos and articles to navigate through the dApp.

(image)

Milestone 2: Sale of $5M artworks

This milestone aims to reach a stage where we have successfully implemented the on-chain governance, sourced the artworks for users to collect / invest on-chain and have allowed Web 2 users to use the dApp in what will feel like a seamless experience. Normally, startups have 20x revenue multiples. The valuation after completing this stage will be $100M.

Multi-chain purchases: Users will be able to purchase artworks at the desired chains (e.g. ETH and BSC). We will send the fALTs into the same wallet only on EVMOS, thus flywheel EVMOS’ user acquisition further.

Documentation : Ensure the documentation for multi-chain purposes are up to date and provide a seamless experience for all chain users.

Artwork acquisition : We acquire at least 50 reliable brokers to source investment-grade artworks all over the world. The artworks must be appreciated by professionals and acquired by Renaissance Labs if they can be acquired lower than the market price.

Artwork Curation Videos : Each acquired artwork is carefully and professionally curated with videos to ensure the quality and condition of the piece. Regular JPEGs and PNGs may fail to capture the aura. The curation videos will be used to

Metrics : We plan to transparently disclose relevant metrics on user engagement information such as the number of user acquisition and gas usage by the contracts. This will include a readable and clean UI in the form of charts.

Fiat on-ramp: We will work with EVMOS team to bring fiat on-ramps to EVMOS. We expect the fiat on-ramp to drastically increases the amount of transactions and users.

Web 2 User Guides: For Web 2 users, the user guide from Milestone must be updated. Using a Metamask or Keplr wallet is a treacherous journey for a new comer.

(image)

Milestone 3: Lending Protocol

This milestone is where our real plans begin to unveil. The lending facility allows for permission-less lending and debt origination with fALTs and other ERC-20s as collateral assets to EVMOS. The primary goal is to allow anyone to create a market between a pair of ERC-20 tokens at EVMOS. Any token with an oracle data feed can be used as collateral.

Lender: Lenders provide asset tokens in exchange for fTokens.

Borrower: Borrowers provide fALT or other collateral tokens in exchange to receive Asset Tokens. Borrowing incurs an interest rate which is to be paid to the lenders upon the redemption of fALTs.

Oracle: Oracle for EVMOS to calculate the market price for the fALT and asset tokens.

Rate Calculator: The contracts give an interest rate based on the amount of available capital to borrow. With less borrowers, the rate will be higher and vice versa.

Artwork Pricing Algorithm: We will build a proprietary pricing algorithm for artworks. The algorithms are used to allow the lenders to know which

Loan-To-Value: The borrower will have a Loan-To-Vale (LTV) to represent the ratio between the loan and the collateral deposited. The LTV will decide the health range of the borrower’s position.

Liquidator: When the borrower’s LTV is beyond the maximum LTV, liquidators can repay the debt for the borrower and receive the collateral with liquidation fees.

(image)

Milestone 4: Artist Index (fALTI)

This milestone’s objective is to create liquidity for the illiquid artworks by creating indices. fALTI is the liquidity aggregator for the illiquid artworks. It’s pegged to the basket of fALTs to track inflation and price variations of the assets held.

The creators of an artist index has a creator fee in perpetuity to incentivize third-parties to create new indices and receive trading fees by providing liquidity on a DEX. The indices aim to be on-chain value account of the basket of assets held.

Artist-based Index: We will create an index token comprised of basket of the artists’ pieces. The creator of the index token will have to burn ALT to create the index and will be receive the origination fee in perpetuity until the community decides otherwise. The liquidity providers are able to accrue the trading fees.

Whitelisting for Index: Only whitelisted assets will be able to added on to an index for the fALT. This is to ensure only the relevant assets are held into the index.

Asset addition into index: fALTs whitelisted in the index token can be added to the index at anytime. The index grows in value of the fALT added into the index and mints new tokens to the user adding fALT. This allows the fALT owner to obtain instant liquidity through indices and index investors to have a hedging agent when investing into a more liquid basket, while also investing into an illiquid artwork alone.

Liquidity Incentive: We plan to work with EVMOS team to create more liquid indices to allow the free trading of fALTs. EVMOS acquires more transactions and users, and Renaissance Labs further reaps the benefits of the dApp Store.

(image)

Funding

Renaissance Labs commits to raising capital for $ALT to provide working capital for hiring talents and finding the right partners. We will work towards creating ties with institutions and commercial partners to further adoption of EVMOS ecosystem and the protocol.

For the higher valuation, this is how our MVP-0 is doing with just paid marketing. Our hypothesis here is "Will people purchase fractionalized artworks that we curated?" It's safe to say we found the product market fit with this conversion rate. The conversion rate fluctuates between high 9% to low 10%. Most of the users are buying around $100-$200 on a brand new app. We want to scale the app aggressively.

Community and Governance

The stakeholders commit to develop and foster the EVMOS ecosystem. Renaissance Labs ensure that governance practices are intact to vote on treasury allocations, protocol parameters and seek for community feedbacks to implement new features and improvements.

Conclusion

With this proposal, Renaissance Labs seek the community’s support to expedite the Web 2 user and physical asset onboarding onto EVMOS. Renaissance Labs will create the killer dApps fully built on EVMOS to inter-operate with other Cosmos chains.

The roadmap is to ensure that the agendas of Renaissance Labs and EVMOS are aligned and the required funding is appropriate for each milestone in the eyes of the EVMOS community. Renaissance Labs is committed to bringing on a wave of new users and fair economic opportunities for all.

People came in for the opportunity to make a quick buck in a new and fastest rising asset class. What we found particularly interesting was that NFTs have turned everyday investors into collectors. Unfortunately, most of the NFTs did not have any utility nor the community to survive the market and gradually faded away\\nNFTs were mirroring the innate desires to collect non-fungible assets, represent its community and derive value. Then, why don’t we bring the investment-grade collectible in the real-world on-chain? This is where we come in. USDC and USDT have shown a proven and centralized issuance model, where a redeemable token representing the actual asset, removes the need for the intermediary, whilst being fast and customizable on-chain.\\nWe’re embracing the same model for physical assets, starting with contemporary artworks. We transparently disclose the information on the location, condition and authenticity with professional curators and appraisers with tens of years of experience. Circle’s fast-growing success was largely based on the transparency over its competitor, USDT, and that’s us.\\n\\nFractionalized Alternative Asset (fALT) are the tokenized shares of the physical assets, verified and stored by Renaissance Labs, starting with contemporary art. Each asset is insured and legally protected, so you don’t have to worry about any mishaps.\\nCreating a killer dApp for Web 2.0 and Web 3.0 users alike is difficult. The product that fits into both categories involve a tint of centralization and a UX journey that’s attractive and fast. There’s not been an initiative to promote the network usage as EVMOS did with the dApp Store. We’ve found a product that facilitates large amounts of transactions, attractive enough for Web 2.0 users accustomed to paid marketing, while sustaining every aspect of DeFi in every vein of the dApp.\\n\\nProposer\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nRenaissance Labs is an entity in South Korea, whose goal is to issue tokens representing shares of the artworks and the largest $ALT holder at start to flywheel the curation process. Renaissance Labs has expertise in building the core infrastructure and scaling dApps for EVMs and EVMOS.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\" We were the first place in 2022 HackATOM - EVMOS Track and the first place in ETHSeoul.\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nJung Mu Kim is a Cornell University graduate and the founder of Renaissance DAO - NFT fractionalization protocol. He’s responsible for scaling a team and designing the protocol / tokenomics. He worked at Samsung Electronics as a AI researcher, responsible for developing random walk and product pricing algorithms. After Samsung, Jung had run a marketing agency for 3 years. He’s experienced with financing / budgeting for the team, growing businesses and apps, and running the operations at a global scale.\\n\\nSung Rae Kim is a full-stack engineer with 10 years of software development experience. He is responsible for the development of solidity contracts. Working at Toss — the multi-billion startup in South Korea for developing an app loved by everyone — as a full-stack dev and Donable — a donation after service app — as the CTO, he was responsible for architectural design and app development for Web 2 and 3 users. He has a solid solidity background (no pun intended) from contributing in LiquidDAO, KlayCash, HelloChain for the past 3 years.\\n\\nJae Hyun Lee is a RISD graduate and CEO of Geomang Creative Studio, an artist agency in South Korea. He’s been an independent painter, creating and curating artworks for major exhibitions. He’s responsible for onboarding artists for Renaissance Labs. He has sourced exclusive works from Eun Jin Kim, Dew Kim and Jeong Ui Yun. Geomagnetic Creative Studio is one of the most wanted gallery and artist agency by contemporary artists.\\n\\nVasariDAO is an extension of Renaissance Labs that offers deep dives and curations of the artworks and onboarding artists. Deeply grounded by decentralization, the DAO selects an artist to onboard with on-chain voting and releasing their works on-chain as NFTs or fractionalizing them on Renaissance Labs.\\n\\nGovernance Votes\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThe following items summarize the voting options and what it means for this proposal. All addresses that vote on the proposal might be eligible for a future airdrop.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"YES\"},{\"insert\":\": You approve the proposal statements and distribute the amount of $3M in \"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"EVMOS\"},{\"insert\":\" to the multisig address and receive 30,000,000 \"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"ALT (10% of the total supply)\"},{\"insert\":\" to the Community Fund treasury. The treasury will allocate the funds to the Renaissance Labs team, leading the core development efforts and supporting the dApp’s go-to-market strategy. It will also lead to core technology maintenance and continuous discussion to ensure the project’s longevity.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"NO\"},{\"insert\":\": The NO vote is a request for improvements or adjustments. You agree that this proposal’s motivation is valuable and that the team should create a follow-up proposal once the amendments are included.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"NO (VETO)\"},{\"insert\":\": You veto the entire motivation for the proposal and expect the core team and current maintainers to make the determination and continue the stewardship of the project. The proposers will not create a follow-up proposal.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"ABSTAIN\"},{\"insert\":\": You are impartial to the outcome of the proposal.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nMultisig and release of funds\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nUpon the approval of the proposal, the treasury will distribute the funds to a ⅔ multi-signature account managed by the following individuals/partners:\\n\\nJung Mu Kim - Renaissance Labs (Proposer)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Tricky or LPX - EVMOS\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"1 Community Member\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThe account address is: 0x16182E0d7Ba52764A982552DfDdFDe8519feE7DF\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"If the proposal passes, the team will immediately receive 40% of the funds to expand its engineering team, artwork acquisition team and other business development efforts to support GTM for the dApp. The remaining 60% will be released in an equal proportion to the number of milestones upon the completion of each milestone. For any reason, if the proposer has not completed the next milestone within a year of the last payment, the remaining funds held in the multisig account will be returned to the community pool.\\n\\nProduct commitment\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThe current proposal aims to develop all the necessary components for a successful tokenization of contemporary artworks. Our team will lead the core development efforts to execute the points below.\\n\\nHard Commitments\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThese are the items that are mandatory for the release of funds. The items will be split into four milestones. We expect to complete all the milestones within the year of launch. Yes, we work fast.\\n\\nMilestone 1: $ALT and $fALT Launch\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThis milestone is to distribute $ALT in a launch and flywheel the $fALT distribution with on chain governance to select the desired artworks by the community. The following are the tech specs required:\\n\\nALTToken (ERC20): ALT Token native to EVMOS\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"fALTToken (ERC20)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"wfALTToken (ERC20)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"fALTSale: Used for the first sales of fALT\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"ALTDrop: ALT Token air-dropped in accordance to fALT purchase amount\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Buyback : Buying back the ALT token at specified price with respective cliff. More details are outlined in the tokenomics.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Vote : On-chain governance on artworks yet to be sourced. If the vote is successful, the voters will receive 10% discount on the offerings.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Liquid-Wrapper : Wrapping ownership-sharing fALT Tokens into liquid wfALTToken. The Korean government dictates that the fALT tokens are actual representation of the underlying asset. Therefore, we designed a whitelisting process for the fALT token to not fall under any third party outside the interest of artwork sales. The liquid-wrapper allows the underlying fALT tokens to remain in the protocol until the artwork sale and the wrapped tokens to trade without governance over the sales.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"ALT Airdrop: $ALT will be airdropped to EVMOS holders and fALT purchasers. The ALT drop amount will increase in respect to the amount of fALTs purchased.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"ALT Initial Offering: Sale of $ALT tokens with price increase cliffs at the number of tokens sold.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Bridge: Bridge between ETH and EVMOS for ALT, fALT, wfALT.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Documentation: Ensure the documentations for both ALT and fALT contracts are up to date with the implementation. The team will create an in-depth how-to videos and articles to navigate through the dApp.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":{\"image\":\"https://commonwealth-uploads.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/ee8b40f6-e9a4-427e-a2b4-6ffccee39a74.1667571093070\"}},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nMilestone 2: Sale of $5M artworks\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThis milestone aims to reach a stage where we have successfully implemented the on-chain governance, sourced the artworks for users to collect / invest on-chain and have allowed Web 2 users to use the dApp in what will feel like a seamless experience. Normally, startups have 20x revenue multiples. The valuation after completing this stage will be $100M.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Multi-chain purchases:\"},{\"insert\":\" Users will be able to purchase artworks at the desired chains (e.g. ETH and BSC). We will send the fALTs into the same wallet only on EVMOS, thus flywheel EVMOS’ user acquisition further.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Documentation\"},{\"insert\":\": Ensure the documentation for multi-chain purposes are up to date and provide a seamless experience for all chain users.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Artwork acquisition\"},{\"insert\":\": We acquire at least 50 reliable brokers to source investment-grade artworks all over the world. The artworks must be appreciated by professionals and acquired by Renaissance Labs if they can be acquired lower than the market price.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Artwork Curation Videos\"},{\"insert\":\": Each acquired artwork is carefully and professionally curated with videos to ensure the quality and condition of the piece. Regular JPEGs and PNGs may fail to capture the aura. The curation videos will be used to\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Metrics\"},{\"insert\":\": We plan to transparently disclose relevant metrics on user engagement information such as the number of user acquisition and gas usage by the contracts. This will include a readable and clean UI in the form of charts.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Fiat on-ramp:\"},{\"insert\":\" We will work with EVMOS team to bring fiat on-ramps to EVMOS. We expect the fiat on-ramp to drastically increases the amount of transactions and users.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Web 2 User Guides:\"},{\"insert\":\" For Web 2 users, the user guide from Milestone must be updated. Using a Metamask or Keplr wallet is a treacherous journey for a new comer.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":{\"image\":\"https://commonwealth-uploads.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/44c6d145-dfe5-40c5-b426-cbb9a8fc611d.1667571135780\"}},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nMilestone 3: Lending Protocol\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThis milestone is where our real plans begin to unveil. The lending facility allows for permission-less lending and debt origination with fALTs and other ERC-20s as collateral assets to EVMOS. The primary goal is to allow anyone to create a market between a pair of ERC-20 tokens at EVMOS. Any token with an oracle data feed can be used as collateral.\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Lender:\"},{\"insert\":\" Lenders provide asset tokens in exchange for fTokens.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Borrower:\"},{\"insert\":\" Borrowers provide fALT or other collateral tokens in exchange to receive Asset Tokens. Borrowing incurs an interest rate which is to be paid to the lenders upon the redemption of fALTs.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Oracle:\"},{\"insert\":\" Oracle for EVMOS to calculate the market price for the fALT and asset tokens.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Rate Calculator:\"},{\"insert\":\" The contracts give an interest rate based on the amount of available capital to borrow. With less borrowers, the rate will be higher and vice versa.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Artwork Pricing Algorithm:\"},{\"insert\":\" We will build a proprietary pricing algorithm for artworks. The algorithms are used to allow the lenders to know which\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Loan-To-Value:\"},{\"insert\":\" The borrower will have a Loan-To-Vale (LTV) to represent the ratio between the loan and the collateral deposited. The LTV will decide the health range of the borrower’s position.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Liquidator:\"},{\"insert\":\" When the borrower’s LTV is beyond the maximum LTV, liquidators can repay the debt for the borrower and receive the collateral with liquidation fees.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":{\"image\":\"https://commonwealth-uploads.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/70fc4f37-ee9d-4497-a377-b5a13754603c.1667571503096\"}},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Milestone 4: Artist Index (fALTI)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThis milestone’s objective is to create liquidity for the illiquid artworks by creating indices. fALTI is the liquidity aggregator for the illiquid artworks. It’s pegged to the basket of fALTs to track inflation and price variations of the assets held.\\n\\nThe creators of an artist index has a creator fee in perpetuity to incentivize third-parties to create new indices and receive trading fees by providing liquidity on a DEX. The indices aim to be on-chain value account of the basket of assets held.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Artist-based Index:\"},{\"insert\":\" We will create an index token comprised of basket of the artists’ pieces. The creator of the index token will have to \"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"burn ALT\"},{\"insert\":\" to create the index and will be receive the origination fee in perpetuity until the community decides otherwise. The liquidity providers are able to accrue the trading fees.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Whitelisting for Index:\"},{\"insert\":\" Only whitelisted assets will be able to added on to an index for the fALT. This is to ensure only the relevant assets are held into the index.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Asset addition into index:\"},{\"insert\":\" fALTs whitelisted in the index token can be added to the index at anytime. The index grows in value of the fALT added into the index and mints new tokens to the user adding fALT. This allows the fALT owner to obtain instant liquidity through indices and index investors to have a hedging agent when investing into a more liquid basket, while also investing into an illiquid artwork alone.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Liquidity Incentive:\"},{\"insert\":\" We plan to work with EVMOS team to create more liquid indices to allow the free trading of fALTs. EVMOS acquires more transactions and users, and Renaissance Labs further reaps the benefits of the dApp Store.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":{\"image\":\"https://commonwealth-uploads.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/439ce1bb-f1dc-45bb-8751-232b5ea11380.1667571538889\"}},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Funding\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nRenaissance Labs commits to raising capital for $ALT to provide working capital for hiring talents and finding the right partners. We will work towards creating ties with institutions and commercial partners to further adoption of EVMOS ecosystem and the protocol.\\n\\nFor the higher valuation, this is how our MVP-0 is doing with just paid marketing. Our hypothesis here is \\\"Will people purchase fractionalized artworks that we curated?\\\" It's safe to say we found the product market fit with this conversion rate. The conversion rate fluctuates between high 9% to low 10%. Most of the users are buying around $100-$200 on a brand new app. We want to scale the app aggressively.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Community and Governance\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThe stakeholders commit to develop and foster the EVMOS ecosystem. Renaissance Labs ensure that governance practices are intact to vote on treasury allocations, protocol parameters and seek for community feedbacks to implement new features and improvements.\\n\\nConclusion\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nWith this proposal, Renaissance Labs seek the community’s support to expedite the Web 2 user and physical asset onboarding onto EVMOS. Renaissance Labs will create the killer dApps fully built on EVMOS to inter-operate with other Cosmos chains.\\n\\nThe roadmap is to ensure that the agendas of Renaissance Labs and EVMOS are aligned and the required funding is appropriate for each milestone in the eyes of the EVMOS community. Renaissance Labs is committed to bringing on a wave of new users and fair economic opportunities for all.\\n\\nTake a look at our website: \\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://lowkeys.io/\"},\"insert\":\"https://lowkeys.io/\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"}]}"}

topic.name: 3. Community Treasury
topic.description: Governance Proposal to ask for funds from the community treasury

result.title: The%20Orb%3A%20Evmos%20Public%20Goods%20Funding
result.plaintext:
Abstract

A wide variety of web3 public goods (such as tools, plugins and educational content) provide necessary infrastructure essential to the growth of blockchain ecosystems.

Most web3 public goods and open-source software rely on donations to fund their work. With the introduction of crypto, much has been done to complement the traditional donation process (i.e individuals and/or charities raise funds in order to donate to causes) including the introduction of crypto-based payments, quadratic funding, tokenized rewards to donors, etc.

Despite these evolutions, donations are still made by giving money from your available capital to a public good. This results in an opportunity cost whereby donors forgo financial gain in favor of supporting a charity or cause. For smaller donors with lesser wealth, continuing to donate in this way may be more daunting as it relies on their ability to replenish their principal.

Through The Orb, we change this paradigm by introducing a novel way to fund web3 public goods. Instead of donating principal to public goods, donors allocate a portion of their yield from staked capital. This injects capital back into the ecosystem and enables donors to participate in a predictable, long-term manner.

In order to compensate for the donated yield, The Orb compounds yield to achieve a much higher APY. It also issues Orb governance tokens so donors get a say in which projects are funded, and awards donors with NFT, swag, etc. to channel natural reward/status seeking behavior into public goods.

In the prevailing staking model, proof-of-stake facilitates the extraction of financial value to stakers, but only provides limited mechanisms (e.g. restaking) to reinject value back into the ecosystem.

Through The Orb, stakers can provide essential support needed for the development of foundational technologies such as tools, plugins and educational content.

Donating to these shared resources unlock enormous value as they accelerate adoption by making it easier to onboard developers, dapps and users. This in-turn redistributes value back to all stakeholders, creating a circular economy.

In this proposal we seek community support to set up The Orb and stake some of the Evmos community’s capital (currently locked by the foundation) through The Orb in order to bootstrap public goods funding within the Evmos ecosystem.

Definition of a web3 public good

The traditional definition of a public good is a commodity or service that is provided without profit to all members of a society. In web3, the definition of a public good is different. It consists of the following characteristics:

Has longevity: It’s both achievable and indefinitely maintainable.

Creates positive externalities: It benefits a larger audience and goes beyond an immediate set of users.

Is universally accessible: It should be accessible to anyone in the world and is both free to use and open-source.

Examples of public goods

Foundry: A development tool to build Ethereum applications used by many thousands of developers ( https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry )

POAPs: NFT badges issued to commemorate events such as twitter spaces calls and hundreds of crypto conferences ( https://poap.gallery )

Devpill.me : A community led blockchain development guide ( https://www.devpill.me/ )

Lenster: A decentralized, and permissionless social media app ( https://lenster.xyz )

Bloom Network: An international community of people and projects creating and nurturing regenerative cultures ( https://bloomnetwork.org/ )

Project overview

Many web3 public goods primarily rely on donations to fund their work. These include developer tools, plugins, extensions and educational content that are managed and maintained by millions of downstream contributors.

Given the importance of donations, much work has been done in web3 to facilitate the fundraising process. Platforms such as Giveth, Gitcoin and Protocol Guild amongst others have reorganized funding in web3 to be more efficient, transparent and rewarding to donors.

Notable improvements include:

Increased opportunities for not-for-profit projects to receive donations in crypto

Optimized distribution with seasonal funding rounds and better fund allocation methods such as matching grants, quadratic funding and vesting contracts

Improved incentives through tokenizing contributions and offering donor rewards in the form of financial tokens and NFTs

Yet, little has been done to change the traditional model of donation. In the current model, donors incur an opportunity cost in order to support a cause, as they forgo future gains from their principal.

This can be challenging for many donors with lesser wealth, as it relies on their ability to replenish their principal in order to continue making donations.

In the prevailing staking model, proof-of-stake extracts financial value to stakers, without providing many mechanisms (aside from restaking) to reinject value back into the ecosystem.

Through The Orb, we change this paradigm by introducing a novel way to fund web3 public goods.

Donors stake their capital, and allocate a portion of their gains to public goods. This injects capital back into the ecosystem in a way that benefits everyone.

As a result, donors don't diminish their principal, while participating in a predictable, long-term funding model for public goods.

Why this matters

By reinjecting yield into public goods, donors provide the essential support needed for the development of foundational technology such as tools, plugins and educational content that benefit the entire ecosystem continuously and effortlessly.

These shared resources unlock enormous value as they accelerate adoption by making it easier to onboard more developers, dapps and users.

Reinjecting yield from staked capital into an ecosystem redistributes value to all stakeholders, creating a circular economy.

Wen ATH? :)

(image)

How it works

Users stake Evmos through The Orb Program. They can choose any validator, including any node they are already staking on.

The Orb program auto-compounds daily on behalf of the user (for a much higher ROI), allocates 15% to the public goods treasury and distributes the rest of the yield back to the user.

Funds are allocated to public goods projects including the Orb, which retains a portion for operating, maintaining and growing the project.

Governance

For each Evmos token donated to public goods, donors receive governance tokens.

Funds collected in The Orb Public Goods Treasury are managed by a DAO controlled by donors.

These tokens allow governance across 3 vectors:

Proposals and projects that would receive funding

Orb strategic decisions (operations, fees, legal etc.)

Electing and removing project vetting council members

Vision

To generate predictable, long-term funding for public goods, while securing blockchains and developing ecosystems.

Website URL

www.stakeorb.xyz

Fees and Funding Structure

Anyone can deploy funds to any Evmos node and receive 85% of the yield generated as a reward.

The balance 15%, will be allocated to The Orb public goods treasury.

Governance token holders will be able to vote on how the funds are allocated.

Returns

Returns will vary based on the block reward Evmos emission schedule. The current APY can be viewed here .

Challenges and Risks

Attacks/Hacks on the ecosystem (blockchain, nodes, bridges, wallets, dapp etc.)

Donating rewards to The Orb when liquid staking is introduced

Slashing events

Node downtime/jailing

Ability to attract public goods

Tax concessions (in different jurisdictions)

Project Selection

The public goods need to directly benefit the Evmos ecosystem.

Projects must also fulfill the criteria set out in the public goods definition section.

All projects requesting funds and fund emission schedules are subject to approval by governance.

Roadmap

Setup public goods node (2 weeks): Setup the Evmos non-custodial yield optimization app.

Setup The Orb DAO and multi-sig treasury (8 weeks): Setup The Orb DAO, the public goods multisig and The Orb foundation as a not-for-profit entity.

Token airdrop contract (2 weeks): Issue governance tokens to donors.

Setup public goods application process (12 weeks): Setup the applicant website and finalize the fund distribution mechanism.

Launch Orb grants season 1: Fund first public goods.

Team

The team behind The Orb consists of:

Sheran (@sheran_sc), Patrick (@iampotrok) and Sam (@samirxcv): Core contributors of Lighthouse DAO (@lighthouse_dao), a decentralized proof-of-contribution protocol for web3 reputation and credentialing. Currently working on bringing the Lighthouse protocol to Evmos.

Sebastien Couture (@seb3point0): Founder of Interop Ventures (@InteropVC), host of the Epicenter and The Interop podcasts, currently running Evmos Node “Interop”.

William Mougayar (@wmougayar): Early investor and advisory board member of the Ethereum Foundation, Executive Chairman, Kin Foundation.

Jean-Philippe Jabre (@jpjabre1): Founder of Plassa Capital and investor in the Jabcap Family Office interested in public goods funding mechanisms.

Requests

1. Request to channel existing locked capital by the Evmos Foundation through The Orb

The Evmos foundation recently staked approx. $10M Evmos on medium-sized nodes to promote network decentralization. We would like to explore the possibility of:

Re-staking a portion of the existing delegation to the same mid-sized nodes through The Orb program.

Issue a new delegation of $2M to 5M from the community pool to mid-sized nodes promoting further network decentralization through The Orb program.

Staking through The Orb program has no impact on nodes, but it allocates 15% of the yield to the public goods treasury, which is controlled by Orb token holders.

The capital staked will not be accessible to us and will be owned by the Evmos community.

The exact request of funds will be decided based on the outcome of the poll attached to this discussion.

2. Request for funds

120,000 EVMOS vesting over 1 year to bootstrap The Orb foundation. These funds will be used to cover:

Development costs: The funds will be used to develop the non-custodial yield optimization app, token airdrop contracts, grant application process and associated website.

Maintenance costs (during the bootstrap period): The funds will also be used to cover maintenance costs for a period of 1 year. These include patches and updates, monitoring, infrastructure costs etc associated with managing and maintaining Orb services. After 1 year, our goal is to fund this through The Orb DAO (subject to governance) which itself would be a public good.

Setup costs related to The Orb Foundation: The funds will also be used to cover any setup costs including legal fees associated with setting up The Orb Foundation as a not-for-profit entity.

Fund allocation breakdown

25% - At the start of the project

50% - At the governance token airdrop event

25% - At The Orb grants S1 launch

Frequently Asked

1. Which nodes will I be able to stake on?

You can stake on any Evmos node through The Orb program.

2. Will The Orb be set up as a not-for-profit?

Yes.

3. Will The Orb be run as an Evmos Workstream / Sub-DAO?

We are open to the idea! The specific mechanisms need to be discussed.

4. What makes this better than traditional grants programs?

We purposefully designed The Orb to be a community-centric, egalitarian public good. It is very much a public good for public goods. In this way, our value proposition is what distinguishes us from other grants programs. We allow users and organizations to grow their capital while also creating a steady flow of capital towards a public goods treasury.

This process aligns incentives for all parties involved: donors/stakers, the public goods projects, The Orb, and the Evmos ecosystem. Furthermore, one-off donations are fleeting as they lack to establish a relationship between the donor and the cause. The Orb, however, offers continuous access to these donors to vote on further funding of projects (and, in turn, the future direction of Evmos) for as long as the user is a part of the DAO

5. Who decides which projects get funded?

The Orb governance token holders. These tokens can be acquired by anyone contributing to public goods through The Orb.

6. What about early contributors having a lion share of the voting power?

While governance tokens are allocated based on contributions to public goods, the exact governance mechanism can be finalized and tweaked as the project progresses.

7. Is The Orb chain specific?

Yes. Other than the idea and concept, all operational aspects including governance, project selection, vetting, and funding are all decided by the Evmos community. We hope to foster a culture of public goods that’s specific to Evmos, while learning lessons from other chains and improving the project as a whole for everyone!

8. How will you ensure the safety of the treasury from being exploited & DAO from spam?

The treasury will be controlled by a multisig and all requests for funding will follow an application process governed by a project vetting council.

9. How would The Orb work in conjunction with Liquid Staking?

It’s still too early to tell. Two possible solutions are:

We partner with the liquid staking service so that funds can directly be staked on The Orb

We re-wrap the synthetic asset and issue our own token

References

a16z: The web3 landscape October 2021 [ https://a16z.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/The-web3-Readlng-List.pdf ]

Gitcoin: Seeking a New Kind of Public Good: Open Call for Proposals [ https://gitcoin.co/blog/seeking-a-new-kind-of-public-good/ ]

Ten Reasons Why People Don’t Donate to Charity [ https://www.thelifeyoucansave.org/common-objections-to-giving/ ]

A Guide To Public Goods for New Web3 Devs [ https://medium.com/ankr-network/a-guide-to-public-goods-for-new-web3-devs-59befc40ae77 ]

Funding Public Goods in web3 for the Uninitiated [ https://jessykate.medium.com/funding-public-goods-in-web3-for-the-uninitiated-27493693c25c ]

Recent discussions

Interoperable Smart Contacts on Cosmos – Jacob Gadikian of Notional Labs https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OkdKfPVjTss (From 09:00 onward)

MEV in the interchain – Sean Braithwaite of Mekatek: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7RW8i2vUeuo&t=3232s (From minute 53:52 onward)
