result.title: Registration of the Following for ERC20 Representation: REGEN, JUNO, STAR, and Axelar Assets
result.plaintext:
**Summary**

In an effort to grow both the Evmos as well as Cosmos ecosystem, we must continually seek to collaborate and welcome IBC friends into the world of EVM on Cosmos. 

The Evmos ERC20 Module (x/erc20) allows the conversion of ERC20 tokens into IBC assets and vice versa. ERC20 representations opens a wide array of potential "EVM-style" DeFi usages to these IBC assets, while introducing native ERC20 tokens into the world of the IBC interoperability. More about the ERC20 module can be read [here](https://medium.com/evmos/introducing-evmos-erc20-module-f40a61e05273). 

**Proposed Tokens for ERC20 Representation**

The list of following tokens were selected by the core team and we would like community feedback before putting these to vote on chain.

- REGEN (https://www.regen.network/) - Regen Network is a community driven DAO with the goals of empowering and incubating initiatives for a greener earth with tokenized carbon credits.

- JUNO (https://www.junonetwork.io/) - Juno is a fellow Cosmos based smart contracting network that utilize CosmWasm for its contracts. EVM/Solidity <> CosmWasm interoperability is something that the whole IBC ecosystem should be excited about!

- STAR (https://www.stargaze.zone/) - STAR is the native token of Stargaze, the undisputed leader in Cosmos' NFT space. With work being done on 721 interoperability, Stargaze is a project we also hope to have a long fruitful relationship with.

- axlUSDC
- axlDAI
- axlWETH
- axlWBTC
- axlDOT (https://polkadot.network/)
- axlMKR  (https://makerdao.com/en/)

Axelar tokens (denoted by the prefix 'axl') are assets that have already been launched by the Axelar Network -- a project that is bringing much more that just bridging to the EVM <> IBC interoperability initiatives. The message transport layer by Axelar will bring cross-chain interoperable "xapps" and the potentials it brings to the table are endless. More about Axelar: https://axelar.network/

**Disclaimer:**

Registering these tokens for ERC20 representation does not necessarily guarantee that there will be any incentive programs or partnerships. However, it is undeniable that all these projects bring great value to the IBC ecosystem, and Evmos would love to collaborate and grow together.

**Execution:**

This proposal will result in 9 (potentially more) on-chain votes. Each ERC20 registration must have its own vote, so please voice any concerns or ideas you may have.

result.title: Further Expanding the Validator Set to 153 or 155
result.plaintext:
Hey everyone

Currently, the Evmos network is secured by 150 validators. The entry barrier (120k Evmos) to enter the active set is quite high. On the Evmos Validator Fairness Initiative a discussion has been started to further expand the set.

The Evmos network, with its current 2s block time, is stable. On average we do have about 2% of missed blocks across all validators. Increasing the set by a large number (25 or 50) will increase latency and as a result validators will miss more blocks - which could be risky. But I think increasing the set by a small number, like 3 or 5, could be worth a shot. While doing so, we gain live metrics on the performance of the network without putting too much at risk. If it goes well, we further expand the set in very small steps.

Let me know what your thoughts are.

HINT: This is ONLY about expanding the set. Please, do NOT start a discussion UNRELATED to this topic (like EF delegation policy)

result.title: Expand%20Validator%20Set%20to%20160-175
result.plaintext:
The purpose of this thread is to start a discussion on expanding the EVMOS validator set.

There are currently 150 validators. However, there are several quality ones that are just outside the active set. A few who are well outside the active set aren't even attempting to join because, due to massive APR, the barrier to entry is so high.

EVMOS is a new chain and growing rapidly. It has become one of the main chains that new validators join. We should be encouraging quality developers to get involved in the ecosystem, maybe even incentivizing Ethereum developers to join (another Prop?) in.

What better way to start getting involved than by helping secure the chain?

Please share your thoughts on pros and cons of expanding the validator set in the comments.

result.title: Raise%20Governance%20Proposal%20Deposit%20from%2064%20EVMOS%20to%20300%20EVMOS
result.plaintext:
The purpose of this proposal is to raise the min governance deposit from 64 EVMOS to 300 EVMOS (~$675).

64 EVMOS (~$140) is much lower than other large chains (500 JUNO is ~$1200, 64 ATOM is ~$500, 500 OSMO is ~$400)

Current deposit amount makes it easy for bad actors to spam governance with low-quality proposals or advertisements

While it's important to keep governance inclusive, it's crucial to incentivize high-quality contributions. Given that multiple parties can propose governance together and split the deposit, I think 300 EVMOS is a good balance of the equities.

Please share your thoughts.

topic.name: 5. Param Change
topic.description: For any discussions for governance proposals that propose changing Evmos parameters

result.title: [Passed] Raise the Proposal Deposit Amount to 192 EVMOS
result.plaintext:
While we do not want to create an intimidatingly high barrier of entry for those that wish to submit a proposal,  Proposal 38 has shown utter disrespect to the community and is an embarrassment to the chain. While mistakes do happen, and while proposals can unknowingly be posted without following the suggested guidelines, this was certainly not either of those. This was a deliberate exploitation of the current parameters set in place to encourage proposals. We do not endorse censorship, nor do we have the means to remove the spam, but I'm afraid that there could be more copy-cat attempts now that the public has seen the ease of submitting a proposal. 

What does the community think about tripling the deposit amount? Or perhaps even higher? 

Reasoning: If a proposal follows the recommended guidelines, then surely there will be validators on board before it goes to vote. Thus, even if the deposit amount is set high, the actual proposer would not have to deposit the full amount, or any amount at all -- rather, validators or anyone in the community in support of the proposal would step in and make the deposit. This would hopefully ensure that these types of spam will not be a reoccurring nuisance, and encourage the usage of the recommended proposal lifecycles.

result.title: Delay Rektdrop Decay Date to Aug 1st
result.plaintext:
OVERVIEW

This thread aims at gauging community sentiment around pushing back the decay date for the Rektdrop so more users have time to claim their airdrop. Users have experienced barriers to claiming the airdrop that haven't all been fixed as we approach the beginning of decay, and we want to give every user a fair chance at claiming their portion of the Rektdrop.

ABSTRACT

The Rektdrop is set to begin decay on Sunday July 3, 2022 where users who have not claimed their tokens yet will begin to see a small percentage " and start go be directed back towards the community pool. We are now less than 4 days from the start and there are still issues that are preventing users from claiming their full share of the Rektdrop.

The team has made the proper fixes for most of these issue in the upcoming upgrade on Monday July 4th, 2022, but the unclaimed airdrop amounts will begin to decay at no fault of the users even before this upgrade takes place. Community members have expressed concerns over this, and have proposed moving back the decay date to a later date and to reimburse the decayed tokens.

PLAN OF ACTION

We delay the start of the Rektdrop decay to begin on Monday August 1st, 2022.

Signal commitment to reimburse anyone who experienced decay on their airdrop before the newly set date of Monday August 1st, 2022 . These tokens will be reimbursed from the community pool at a later date after all the data is gathered and verified.

We fast track this proposal on chain if there are no concerns or red flags from the community to limit the amount of decay users experience and make step 2 simpler.

This will not only ensure users don't experience decay at no fault of their own, but also give more time for new users to claim this airdrop to promote healthy token distribution for Evmos.

SUMMARY

We push back the Rektdropt decay date to begin on Monday August 1st, 2022 @ approximately 09:00 UTC. We signal agreement that any user who experienced decay before the newly set decay date should have those tokens reimbursed by the community pool at a later time after we gather the proper info and come up with the plan to send these funds back.

Considering the start of decay being less than the socially agreed 3 days for a commonwealth discussion, we may fast track this proposal on chain to limit the decay for users if there is no opposition from community members.

I will update the thread with relevant information and decisions as the discussion matures and it is needed. Feedback back is encouraged and welcomed :)

These tokens will be reimbursed from the community pool at a later date after all the data is gathered and verified.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"ordered\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"We fast track this proposal on chain if there are no concerns or red flags from the community to limit the amount of decay users experience and make step 2 simpler.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"ordered\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThis will not only ensure users don't experience decay at no fault of their own, but also give more time for new users to claim this airdrop to promote healthy token distribution for Evmos.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"SUMMARY\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nWe push back the Rektdropt decay date to begin on \"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Monday August 1st, 2022 @ approximately 09:00 UTC. \"},{\"insert\":\"We signal agreement that any user who experienced decay before the newly set decay date should have those tokens reimbursed by the community pool at a later time after we gather the proper info and come up with the plan to send these funds back.\\n\\nConsidering the start of decay being less than the socially agreed 5 days for a commonwealth discussion, we may fast track this proposal on chain to limit the decay for users if there is no opposition from community members.\\n\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"italic\":true},\"insert\":\"I will update the thread with relevant information and decisions as the discussion matures and it is needed. Feedback back is encouraged and welcomed :)\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"}]}"}

result.title: Global Min Gas Price value for Cosmos SDK and EVM transaction: choosing a value
result.plaintext:
[update] new poll: PLEASE VOTE

Summary

The `MinGasPrice` sets a minimum gas price for transactions (both Cosmos SDK and EVM). The `MinGasPrice` value has priority over other settings: gas price cannot go lower than it, otherwise, the transaction will fail.

I programmed by myself this feature ( https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/pull/610 , later moved to https://github.com/tharsis/ethermint/pull/1104 ), as a volunteer effort.

Specs

Read about the `MinGasPrice`:

- https://docs.evmos.org/modules/feemarket/01_concepts.html#global-minimum-gas-price

- https://docs.evmos.org/modules/feemarket/09_antehandlers.html

- about EVM dynamic (eip-1559) transactions: https://github.com/tharsis/ethermint/blob/23f88315e84d8de74679db02171aee489b30b808/app/ante/fees.go#L109-L116

Choosing a value

I suggest choosing a higher value at first, then a lower value when the price of EVMOS increases.

In order for you to make an informed decision, I prepared a playground for anyone to check the gas prices and test different `MinGasPrice` values: https://observablehq.com/@loredanacirstea/evm-gas-prices

result.title: Enable inflation module
result.plaintext:
Hi all,

I want to start a discussion on enabling the inflation module on Evmos Mainnet.

Why?

When the chain initially launched, the inflation module was enabled and new Evmos tokens were minted and allocated according to the Evmos Token Model once a day until the chain halted.

After the halt, Evmos relaunched with the inflation module disabled for two main reasons:

ensure that the chain is secure and chain upgrades are successful

give more time to those who hadn't been able to claim their airdrop

Now, that several upgrades have passed successfully and more users have claimed their airdrop, inflation could be enabled. Enabling the inflation module would mean, that

staking rewards,

usage incentives and

community pool allocation

are enabled.

Testing on Testnet

With proposal 28 the inflation module has already been enabled on Testnet. Please take part in testing its correctness by

staking tokens: You should receive staking rewards once a day

interacting with registered usage incentives: You should be able to query your gas meters after interacting with an incentivized smart contract. Once a week, your gas meters are reset and you receive Evmos tokens from the incentives pool based on how much gas you spent on interacting with incentivized smart contracts. The incentives pool fills up once a day through inflation

querying the community pool: a part of inflation is allocated in the community pool once a day. Query the community pool to make sure it's increasing according to the Evmos Token Model .

Note, that the team allocation of the Evmos Token Model is not handled through inflation but instead was implemented with vesting accounts .

Discussion

Before voting on the Mainnet proposal please follow and discuss this proposal on this page. For an in-depth explanation of the module, please refer to the module specification .

topic.name: 5. Param Change
topic.description: For any discussions for governance proposals that propose changing Evmos parameters

result.title: Stricter Slashing for Validators Missing Blocks
result.plaintext:
This post is somewhat related to and goes some way towards addressing the concerns brought up in this post.

Assuming an average 6.5s block time on mainnet (evmos_9001-2), active validators can get away with only signing half of the blocks in a ~54 hour window without being slashed. In my humble opinion, this is far too lenient and discourages validators in the active set from taking the proper precautions for ensuring maximum uptime and service continuity. These precautions include: setting up monitoring, beefing up hardware, exchanging tips with and seeking advice from other validators, etc. It also contributes to a less competitive validator landscape that ultimately jeopardizes the security of the network and allows inactive validators to linger in the safety of the top 50 validator slots.

To alleviate this, I recommend the following changes:

SignedBlocksWindow : change from "30000" to "10000".

MinSignedPerWindow : change from "0.500000000000000000" to "0.050000000000000000"

This would effectively cut down on the number of blocks validators are allowed to miss in a specified window. You can find out more about the slashing module in the corresponding specification . For reference, these are the current Evmos params:

evmosd query slashing params --node=https://tendermint.bd.evmos.org:26657/ --output=json | jq . { "signed_blocks_window": "30000", "min_signed_per_window": "0.500000000000000000", "downtime_jail_duration": "1800s", "slash_fraction_double_sign": "0.100000000000000000", "slash_fraction_downtime": "0.005000000000000000" }

The proposed values are similar to those of the Cosmos Hub (you can see all Cosmos Hub params here ):

curl -X GET "https://api.cosmos.network/cosmos/slashing/v1beta1/params" -H "accept: application/json" { "params": { "signed_blocks_window": "10000", "min_signed_per_window": "0.050000000000000000", "downtime_jail_duration": "600s", "slash_fraction_double_sign": "0.050000000000000000", "slash_fraction_downtime": "0.000100000000000000" } }

I imagine that some leniency is still necessary early on, given the recent pains with network congestion and the absolutely monstrous rate of state bloat Evmos validators have had to deal with. As active validators acclimate to the challenges of running a chain like Evmos, I imagine the community will want to increase the MinSignedPerWindow .

Unlike other parameter change proposals, we should NOT make the same proposal to testnet (evmos_9000-4) as both test and main networks have different uptime expectations from their validators and slashing carries different consequences.

Thoughts?

result.title: Enable%20erc20%20module
result.plaintext:
Hey everyone,

I'd like to start discussion here to prepare for enabling the ERC20 Module. The ERC20 Module is used for being able to convert Cosmos ICS20 tokens to ERC20 tokens and vise versa so that dapps on Evmos can incorporate cosmos assets such as ATOM, OSMO, UST. More details can be found in this blog post .

In order to activate the module, an on-chain proposal will take place after an upcoming upgrade to turn on the module. Once done, additional proposals can be made to whitelist specific tokens either from the Cosmos side or from the EVM side.

result.title: Extend%20Claims%20Period%20by%2021%20days
result.plaintext:
Hello Evmos community,

The core Evmos team is proposing to extend the claims period by 21 days, in order to give Cosmos Hub and Osmosis eligible addresses ample time to claim their airdrop allocations. We recommend the following changes:

DurationUntilDecay : change from "3801600s" to "5616000s".

This will result in a total of 65 days from the claim start time (2022-04-29 at 16:00 UTC) for users to claim their EVMOS tokens before the decay period begins (for a duration of 60 days).

As with other parameter change proposals, we will make the same proposal to testnet (evmos_9000-4) to ensure both networks are up to date.

You can find out more about the claims module in the corresponding specification .

topic.name: 5. Param Change

result.title: Temperature%20Check%20-%20Limit%20Voting%20Power
result.plaintext:
EVMOS started and praised itself to be 100% community funded.

The fact that it wasn't involved with any initial VC funding was used as marketing throughout most of EVMOS initial days and it was certainly something to brag about as Evmos was a community effort that came out of an Atom Proposal.

The implications of not being VC funded were that Evmos was in the hand of the community when it came to major decisions through proposals. As it stands now, 23.3% of the voting power in EVMOS is controlled by VC validators who participated in the latest EVMOS Foundation funding round. This may not be the case, but if these validators act like other VC's in other Cosmos chains, then we can assume we won't count with their vote/participation in upcoming proposals. With this, we are taking away voting power from the community and the users of evmos, and putting it away in validators that don't engage in governance and may or may not vote.

Thankfully, we are still early to address this, and a method to prevent voting power from escaping the community would be to implement a voting power cap, which sets a hard limit on how much more voting power can go to these validators.

While it's true that VC's can simply run two nodes and place their excess voting power there, they could also delegate to smaller validators and help decentralization as a sign of supporting the community that builds and uses EVMOS. It would be a small hit of a 5% commission on the excess of their stake, but it would be a strong signal that they trust the community of the chain they invested in. If they decide to start another validator, then it will give us a preview of how they'll behave in the future.

A Voting Power cap is not something unheard of, and has been implemented in other Cosmos chains, and it works. By doing this on Evmos, we can shift the power back to the community and prevent it from completely escaping it to a point where a proposal like this couldn't pass.

The purpose of this proposal is to understand if the community supports the implementation of a cap on validator's voting power.

If there is enough support to this simple idea we can move forward into specifics on like what should the percentage cap be, how should it be implemented and by whom.
version_history: {"timestamp":"2022-11-15T16:50:33.717Z","author":"{\"_judgements\":{},\"_isOnchain\":false,\"_isCouncillor\":false,\"_isValidator\":false,\"_isEmpty\":false,\"_isNameInvalid\":false,\"chain\":\"evmos\",\"address\":\"evmos1rkj60h6cf580yx663hqu062mhamqqtxqrsx8mc\",\"_initialized\":true,\"_name\":\"EVMOS_GUY\",\"_headline\":\"\",\"_bio\":\"\",\"_avatarUrl\":\"\",\"_lastActive\":\"2022-11-14T18:31:52.308Z\"}","body":"{\"ops\":[{\"insert\":\"EVMOS started and praised itself to be 100% community funded. \\n\\nThe fact that it wasn't involved with any initial VC funding was used as marketing throughout most of EVMOS initial days and it was certainly something to brag about as Evmos was a community effort that came out of an Atom Proposal. \\n\\nThe implications of not being VC funded were that Evmos was in the hand of the community when it came to major decisions through proposals. As it stands now, 23.3% of the voting power in EVMOS is controlled by VC validators who participated in the latest EVMOS Foundation funding round. This may not be the case, but if these validators act like other VC's in other Cosmos chains, then we can assume we won't count with their vote/participation in upcoming proposals. With this, we are taking away voting power from the community and the users of evmos, and putting it away in validators that don't engage in governance and may or may not vote. \\n\\nThankfully, we are still early to address this, and a method to prevent voting power from escaping the community would be to implement a voting power cap, which sets a hard limit on how much more voting power can go to these validators. \\n\\nWhile it's true that VC's can simply run two nodes and place their excess voting power there, they could also delegate to smaller validators and help decentralization as a sign of supporting the community that builds and uses EVMOS. It would be a small hit of a 5% commission on the excess of their stake, but it would be a strong signal that they trust the community of the chain they invested in. If they decide to start another validator, then it will give us a preview of how they'll behave in the future. \\n\\nA Voting Power cap is not something unheard of, and has been implemented in other Cosmos chains, and it works. By doing this on Evmos, we can shift the power back to the community and prevent it from completely escaping it to a point where a proposal like this couldn't pass. \\n\\nThe purpose of this proposal is to understand if the community supports the implementation of a cap on validator's voting power. \\n\\nIf there is enough support to this simple idea we can move forward into specifics on like what should the percentage cap be, how should it be implemented and by whom.\\n\"}]}"}

result.title: Nasty%20nasty%20decay
result.plaintext:
Just found out I would have had 350 evmos to claim in an older wallet that I have not been using for a long time. Imported my Metamask address on the rektdrop page, just to find out: it is all gone. This sucks. This has been such a troubled year, even tax authorities around the world extend their deadlines, and here we have a 2 month decay? Seriously? That's bullshit. It has literally become a REKTdrop, muchas gracias!!!!!!

This is not some shitcoin airdrop across every wallet on the blockchain. Every user who was entitled to free EVMOS had some skin in the game and there were active wallet addresses behind each, so why was this not automatically airdropped to the wallets in question? Instead of creating a destructive decay mechanism?

At least the period should have been extended by years, not months. Persistence is what I like most about crypto. If I don´t have contact with my bank for awhile, the account will become dormant and at some point, the account and the money will be gone. Not so with crypto. Even after years of dormancy, the funds are still on the private key, as long as the blockchain exists.

This decay is a nasty thing to do, and so I am asking the question: how realistic is a proposal to remedy the situation? For instance: everyone who would have had an EVMOS airdrop claim, will receive their decayed funds retroactively, without further activity needed from the user side? This could be achieved by an automatic process running at a given date, e.g. end of 2022, or by a permanent link on the dashboard. To keep things simple, entering an address (cosmos or evmos) and hitting "claim" should be enough. So no need to maintain a complicated rektdrop dashboard over the long term.

Currently, the unclaimed funds will be returned to the community wallet, but for what purpose? Pissing off users who missed the deadline, are much less likely to use the project in the future. This will cause more loss of value to the token, than the returned funds will be worth.

result.title: Initial Discussion for Avatree - Incentivized Climate Action, Partnership with Regen Network [REVISED]
result.plaintext:
AVATREE GRANT PROPOSAL // PARTNERSHIP WITH REGEN NETWORK

One Sentence Description: “Sequester-To-Earn” Platform that incentivizes climate action

Website:  www.avatree.xyz

Twitter/IG: @_avatree

MISSION AND VISION

Avatree is a “Sequester-To-Earn” platform where people are incentivized to take climate action.

We see climate change as a collective coordination problem. Since web3 has been incredibly effective at solving such problems, our vision is to adapt key learnings from web3 to onboard millions of people to the climate movement and accelerate carbon sequestration efforts worldwide.

HOW IT WORKS

The user purchases a subscription of carbon credits along with an Avatree NFT, which is a digital sapling. As the user makes their monthly payments to purchase carbon credits, the sapling grows algorithmically and fruits Avatree tokens. This token can be spent to personalize their Avatree NFT, attend IRL / online events and purchase brand rewards. Alternatively the user can trade their tokens on the open market for cash.

BUSINESS MODEL

We earn money by:

1. Charging for Avatree NFTs - $25-$100/each, 100% margin

2. Monthly carbon credit subscription - $10-$100/month, 3.5% margin

3. NFT Resale Revenue - 5% of resale

TEAM

Chetan Nandakumar - CEO/Product:  https://www.linkedin.com/in/cnandakumar

• 10+ years as PM and ML engineer at companies such as Recruitbot & Leap Motion

• Co-founder of Modista.com - computer vision for apparel search

• UC Berkeley PhD in AI & Neuroscience, NSF Graduate Fellow

Tyler Streeter - Graphics Engineer:  https://www.linkedin.com/in/tylerstreeter/

• Founder of iBonsai iOS app, 120K total downloads, 55K paid downloads

• PhD in AI, MS in VR from Iowa State University

• Portfolio: http://tyl.st/projects/

Anusheel Bhushan - Full Stack Engineer: https://www.linkedin.com/in/anusheel/

• Founder of Strive Labs.

• Principal Engineer, eBay

• BS IIT Delhi, MS UC Irvine

Chris Znerold - Design Lead:  https://www.linkedin.com/in/znerold/

• Founder of Stay.Gold Design Firm: www.stay.gold

• Design Lead at AirBnB, Apple Music & Disney Interactive

• Creative Director at PlayStation

• Portfolio:  http://znerold.com/

ADVISORS

Bradley Horowitz, VP Product at Google:  https://www.linkedin.com/in/bradleyhorowitz/

• VP Product at Google

• Former head of GMail, GCalendar, Google Voice, and many other Google teams

• MIT Media Alum

Philip Taylor, Climate Scientist:  https://www.linkedin.com/in/philipgrahamtaylor/

• Climate Fellow at UC Boulder

• Founder Mad Agriculture - helping farmers turn their operations to being regenerative

• PhD from UC Boulder in Climate Science

PARTNERSHIP WITH REGEN NETWORK

Regen Network is a blockchain in the Cosmos ecosystem and a leading provider of carbon and ecological credits in the ReFi space. They will serve as a key partner with us, providing us with the carbon credits that power our platform, and promoting us to their community.

HOW CAN WE BE SURE THESE CREDITS ARE REAL?

The carbon credit / ecological credit industry holds a lot of potential to support climate restoration, but it’s also a new, unregulated industry and ripe with abuse.

We take this issue seriously and are taking the following measures to ensure that the credits purchased through our platform contribute to tangible and meaningful climate action:

1. We will only be selecting those credits that match the following criteria:

Nature based - restoring ecological habitats

Clear and proven additionality - a given habitat would not have been restored without additional funding

Measurable impact - can the activities to preserve or regenerate ecology be measured and confirmed? What are the downstream outcomes from this land preservation or restoration (ie. improvements in soil health, biodiversity, water quality, etc)

2. Regen Network, our supplier for carbon credits, is a pioneer in this ReFi industry and is leading the way for high-end ecological credits and industry standards. Here’s are links to articles about some of their carbon credits:

NCT, Nature Carbon Tonne:  https://medium.com/regen-network/introducing-nature-carbon-ton-nct-6d0fbaaf490d

CarbonPlus Grasslands credits:  https://registry.regen.network/methodologies/carbonplus-grasslands

3. Phil Taylor (see above), a leading climate scientist and entrepreneur, has joined our team as an advisor and will be guiding our carbon credit strategy

4. Using web3 increases transparency around these credits. Each credit will be on-chain and labeled with its location, the person/agency who created the credit, the independent verifier, related images, etc.

MARKET TRENDS

• NFTs grew 23x from 2020 to 2021 into a $23B industry

• The voluntary carbon market will grow 15x and will be worth upwards of $50B by 2030

• There are 10+ consumer carbon offset products on the market, but none have garnered widespread adoption (see “Competition” section below)

CORE ASSUMPTION

Our core assumption is that there’s a massive untapped market of individuals who want to take climate action but just need a nudge to do so. We believe that nudge consists of social and financial incentives.

COMPETITION & UNIQUE VALUE PROPOSITION

There is a burgeoning demand for carbon offsetting products from consumers, and there are 10+ consumer-oriented carbon offsetting products on the market attempting to meet this need.

Some of the key players in our space are Klima, Wren (YC and Union Square Ventures backed), Joro (Sequoia Backed), and Terrapass. All these products take a dry, individualized approach to carbon offsetting. They ask the user questions to assess their carbon footprint, and then allow them to offset it by purchasing a monthly subscription of carbon credits.

Although these products have engaged hundreds of thousands of people, none of them have garnered widespread adoption, leaving open a massive market opportunity. The existing products have poor UX without any gamification or integrated social engagement. By creating a social, incentivized solution, Avatree aims to seize this market opportunity.

DISTRIBUTION

We will grow our user base through web3 and web2 strategies such as community building through Discord / Twitter spaces / influencer engagement, and social media marketing.

Also, by addressing climate, a topic of growing global concern, we can leverage existing communities in the climate space. Since Avatree is a monetized platform, we can sign on these organizations as affiliates, so that they get paid when their members sign up for Avatree.

TRACTION

We launched a preview of our algorithmic tree at  VERSE , an augmented reality art gallery in SF and Denver. Visitors experience the Avatree exhibit as a 16ft 3D hologram that grows from sapling to tree in 4 minutes. We're on display alongside top-end artists such as Android Jones and Zed Run and have become a "crowd favorite" of the gallery. Since February, VERSE has had 15K guests in SF and Denver and will be expanding to 15 locations around the world in 2022.

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

- Accepted to the 2022 Berkeley Blockchain Xcelerator, a non-dilutive accelerator, 6% acceptance rate

- Accepted to the World Economic Forum's 2022 Crypto Impact and Sustainability Accelerator & Crypto Sustainability Coalition

WORKING PROTOTYPE

https://www.dropbox.com/s/pde95ir1u4s24o3/avatree-video.mp4?dl=0

DECK

https://docsend.com/view/nvdvw6q4nyuqkvtp

TECHNICAL ROADMAP

https://www.dropbox.com/s/mrwi491mpv522y1/Avatree%20Tech%20Roadmap.pdf?dl=0

MILESTONES

Milestone 1, Initial Kickoff, Nov 1, 2022

Milestone 2, Dec 15, 2022, $40k

- Algorithmic tree: Create algorithm for single growing tree

- Smart Contract + Web App: Phase 1 (see “Technical Roadmap” for details)

Milestone 3, Feb 1, 2022, $40k

- Algorithmic tree: Create algorithm that can grow multiple trees

- Smart Contract + Web App: Phase 2 (see “Technical Roadmap” for details)

Milestone 4, Mar 15, 2023, $20k

- Smart Contract + Web App: Phase 3 (see “Technical Roadmap” for details)

- Public Launch of Avatree Product to Potential Consumers

TOTAL: $100k

HEADCOUNT BREAKDOWN

Full Stack Engineer, 16 weeks, Full-time, $45/hr, $28.8k

Blockchain Engineer, 12 weeks, Full-time, $60/hr, $28.8k

Graphics/AI Engineer, 8 weeks, Full-time, $70/hr, $20.6

Designer, 16 weeks, Quarter-time, $70/hr, $12k

Smart Contract / Backend Testing and Revision - $10k

BENEFIT TO EVMOS

When we launch the platform (in March 2023) we anticipate selling 2k-5k NFTs. Pricing them at the lower end of the scale, this would translate to $50k-$125k in EVMOS tokens. Additionally, if each person purchases ~$10 in carbon credits per month, this translates to $20k - $50k in carbon credits purchased each month on COSMOS

In one year, we anticipate increasing our userbase to 10k-25k users. So this would translate to $250k-$625k in EVMOS tokens. And then more as we continue to grow the network in the next few years.

FYI, an important distinction with our model is that there is no cap to the the number of NFTs we mint. The financial incentives for participation center around the token rewards generated by the NFTs. Our vision is for this to be a consumer product with hundreds of thousands of users in the years ahead

FUTURE EXPANSION

After the completion of this grant, Avatree will continue to expand its userbase and product offerings. Here are targets planned after the completion of the grant (fyi, these milestones do not correspond to any future disbursements):

Expansion of Userbase to 10k users, Aug 2023

Expansion of Userbase to 15k users, Jan 2023

Expansion of Userbase to 25k users, Nov 2024

OTHER NOTES

We will be converting our grant funds into USDC (or another stablecoin) via an OTC arrangement

Each credit will be on-chain and labeled with its location, the person/agency who created the credit, the independent verifier, related images, etc. \\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"MARKET TRENDS\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n• NFTs grew 23x from 2020 to 2021 into a $23B industry\\n• The voluntary carbon market will grow 15x and will be worth upwards of $50B by 2030\\n• There are 10+ consumer carbon offset products on the market, but none have garnered widespread adoption (see “Competition” section below)\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"CORE ASSUMPTION\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nOur core assumption is that there’s a massive untapped market of individuals who want to take climate action but just need a nudge to do so. We believe that nudge consists of social and financial incentives. \\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"COMPETITION & UNIQUE VALUE PROPOSITION\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThere is a burgeoning demand for carbon offsetting products from consumers, and there are 10+ consumer-oriented carbon offsetting products on the market attempting to meet this need. \\n\\nSome of the key players in our space are Klima, Wren (YC and Union Square Ventures backed), Joro (Sequoia Backed), and Terrapass. All these products take a dry, individualized approach to carbon offsetting. They ask the user questions to assess their carbon footprint, and then allow them to offset it by purchasing a monthly subscription of carbon credits. \\n\\nAlthough these products have engaged hundreds of thousands of people, none of them have garnered widespread adoption, leaving open a massive market opportunity. The existing products have poor UX without any gamification or integrated social engagement. By creating a social, incentivized solution, Avatree aims to seize this market opportunity.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"DISTRIBUTION\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nWe will grow our user base through web3 and web2 strategies such as community building through Discord / Twitter spaces / influencer engagement, and social media marketing. \\n\\nAlso, by addressing climate, a topic of growing global concern, we can leverage existing communities in the climate space. Since Avatree is a monetized platform, we can sign on these organizations as affiliates, so that they get paid when their members sign up for Avatree. \\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"TRACTION\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nWe launched a preview of our algorithmic tree at\"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://versenftcryptoart.com/\"},\"insert\":\" VERSE\"},{\"insert\":\", an augmented reality art gallery in SF and Denver. Visitors experience the Avatree exhibit as a 16ft 3D hologram that grows from sapling to tree in 4 minutes. We're on display alongside top-end artists such as Android Jones and Zed Run and have become a \\\"crowd favorite\\\" of the gallery. Since February, VERSE has had 15K guests in SF and Denver and will be expanding to 15 locations around the world in 2022.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"ACCOMPLISHMENTS\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n- Accepted to the 2022 Berkeley Blockchain Xcelerator, a non-dilutive accelerator, 6% acceptance rate\\n- Accepted to the World Economic Forum's 2022 Crypto Impact and Sustainability Accelerator & Crypto Sustainability Coalition\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"WORKING PROTOTYPE\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://www.dropbox.com/s/pde95ir1u4s24o3/avatree-video.mp4?dl=0\"},\"insert\":\"https://www.dropbox.com/s/pde95ir1u4s24o3/avatree-video.mp4?dl=0\"},{\"insert\":\" \\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"DECK\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://docsend.com/view/nvdvw6q4nyuqkvtp\"},\"insert\":\"https://docsend.com/view/nvdvw6q4nyuqkvtp\"},{\"insert\":\" \\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"TECHNICAL ROADMAP\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://www.dropbox.com/s/mrwi491mpv522y1/Avatree%20Tech%20Roadmap.pdf?dl=0\"},\"insert\":\"https://www.dropbox.com/s/mrwi491mpv522y1/Avatree%20Tech%20Roadmap.pdf?dl=0\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"MILESTONES\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nMilestone 1, Initial Kickoff, Nov 1, 2022\\n\\nMilestone 2, Dec 15, 2022, $40k\\n- Algorithmic tree: Create algorithm for single growing tree\\n- Smart Contract + Web App: Phase 1 (see “Technical Roadmap” for details)\\n\\nMilestone 3, Feb 1, 2022, $40k\\n- Algorithmic tree: Create algorithm that can grow multiple trees \\n- Smart Contract + Web App: Phase 2 (see “Technical Roadmap” for (in March 2023) we anticipate selling 2k-5k NFTs. Pricing them at the lower end of the scale, this would translate to $50k-$125k in EVMOS tokens. Additionally, if each person purchases ~$10 in carbon credits per month, this translates to $20k - $50k in carbon credits purchased each month on COSMOS\\n\\nIn one year, we anticipate increasing our userbase to 10k-25k users. So this would translate to $250k-$625k in EVMOS tokens. And then more as we continue to grow the network in the next few years.\\n\\nFYI, an important distinction with our model is that there is no cap to the the number of NFTs we mint. Here are targets planned after the completion of the grant (fyi, these milestones do not correspond to any future disbursements): \\n\\nExpansion of Userbase to 10k users, Aug 2023\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"ordered\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Expansion of Userbase to 15k users, Jan 2023\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"ordered\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Expansion of Userbase to 25k users, Nov 2024\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"ordered\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"OTHER NOTES\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nWe will be converting our grant funds into USDC (or another stablecoin) via an OTC arrangement\\n\\n\"}]}"}

result.title: Just%20a%20thought%20on%20improving%20decentralization%20through%20delegations
result.plaintext:
Perhaps the best way to decentralize the network is by force!

By this I mean, for every new delegation, how about we force the user to split their delegated tokens between validators of different ranks? For example, only allow the user to select one of the following validator baskets:

a) 1 top 20 validator, 1 top 20-50, and 1 top 50+

b) 1 top 20-50 and top 50+

c) 1 top 50+

For options a and b, the delegations will be split equally between the selected validators. Of course, UI improvements can be made to simplify the user's experience, e.g. save a previously chosen basket. Any thoughts on this?

result.title: Initial%20discussion%20for%20Decentralization%2FValitador%20DAO
result.plaintext:
Wanted to start a conversation of creating a DAO that would help with improving the decentralization of validators by managing delegations to an X amount of validators (I'm thinking 20-30 validators) using funds of the community pool. The DAO would only be able to delegate funds and not spend them, to ensure that the multisig would be composed of trusted members of the community and the evmos team that would evaluate validators on several metrics that contribute to decentralization and growth of the evmos protocol.

Amount could be between 100k to 200k evmos depending on the amount of validators chosen. Rewards of this delegations could go to the community pool or be used to develop decentralization tools (alternative staking front ends, bootstrap promising validators, research ways to improve decentralization, etc.).

All validators considered should be outside the top 20 or even top 50 to ensure that any validator that receives it will help spread the voting power and reward validators that contribute to the ecosystem. Initial metrics that should be considered would be: development work on evmos (code or services offered), no slash from downtime, bare metal infrastructure (not using a cloud provider), known team in the community and proven track record of managing a validator. The time period for delegations should be in the range of 6 months to a year, depending of that we decide as a community.

All opinions are appreciated to refine this idea into a possible solution to help solve the extreme centralization that evmos (and many evmos chains) suffer from.

Resources:

Smart Stake Analytics: https://evmos.smartstake.io/stats

ICF twitter thread about this topic on Cosmos: https://twitter.com/interchain_io/status/1564618684810907650

result.title: %5BTemperature%20Check%5D%20Restarting%20the%20Evmos%20Chain%20State%20from%20a%20State%20Snapshot
result.plaintext:
This is a discussion post. 

I opened this topic now because:
- the rekt drop has been finalized & clawback has happened
- we are at a stage before any L2 systems have been deployed on Evmos (where the past state is necessary)
- we should think about this topic before L2, if we want to enact it
- Evmos chain is very resource-hungry RAM-wise and NVME-wise
- Evmos wants to maintain 2s block finality that will benefit IBC interchain operations (query, dependent tx)
- full state already has grown beyond the first tiers of hardware prices
- lower requirements encourage better decentralization

Evmos state is also filled with spam transactions executed before the [minimum gas price was implemented](https://commonwealth.im/evmos/discussion/5073-global-min-gas-price-value-for-cosmos-sdk-and-evm-transaction-choosing-a-value). These transactions are bloating the state and do not deserve to be on-chain.

Restarting the chain from the snapshotted state should be done before any L2s are deployed or any similar system that needs past data in order to solve/conclude the off-chain state.

## Definitions

- `SNAPSHOT_BLOCK` = last block included in the snapshot 
- `SNAPSHOT_STATE_SIZE` = full state after `SNAPSHOT_BLOCK`, in `MB`

## Method

1. Make the state history available in a searchable DB
2. Consider the state at block `SNAPSHOT_BLOCK` as the start state
3. Full nodes should guarantee state queries only to blocks greater than `SNAPSHOT_BLOCK`

## Proposer

Loredana Cirstea - [Evmos Interchain EVM Office](https://www.mintscan.io/evmos/proposals/45), volunteer from [The Laurel Project](https://evolve.provable.dev/). This proposal is made from a volunteer capacity (independent, unpaid, self-funded, and from the heart).

result.title: Evmos Software Upgrade v8.1.0
result.plaintext:
Hi everyone!

I’m opening up this thread on scheduling the next software upgrade on Mainnet. Please find below an overview of the proposed changes and the motivation behind them. Let us know what you think of the upgrade!

## Author

Daniel Burckhardt ([@danburck](https://twitter.com/danburck)), Evmos Core Team

## Software Upgrade being scheduled with this proposal

If successful, this proposal will schedule an Evmos software upgrade at block height [4,655,500](https://www.mintscan.io/evmos/blocks/4655500) from it's current version [v7.0.0](https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/releases/tag/v7.0.0) to [v8.1.0](https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/releases/tag/v8.1.0).

## Motivation

By proposing a scheduled upgrade, we want to implement a smooth and transparent upgrade process, that is first proposed on testnet and then on mainnet. Software upgrades generally aim to improve current performance and add new features to the Evmos chain. For more information on the types of upgrades, please visit our [Software Upgrade Guide](https://docs.evmos.org/validators/upgrades/overview.html).

## Impact

On a high level, the v8.1.0 software includes the following improvements:


* [Feesplit module](https://docs.evmos.org/modules/feesplit/): Developers can register their smart contracts and earn rewards everytime someone interacts with their registered smart contract
* Upgrade to Ethermint [v0.19.2](https://github.com/evmos/ethermint/releases/tag/v0.19.2): Improves JSON-RPC reliability and maintainability and bumps SDK, Tendermint and IAVL dependencies and adds supports for optional params on EIP712
* Upgrade ibc-go to [v3.2.0](https://github.com/cosmos/ibc-go/releases/tag/v3.2.0) and Cosmos SDK to [v0.45.7]

A full changelog can be found [here](https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/releases/tag/v8.1.0).

## Testing

Prior to this proposal the version v8.1.0 is been upgraded to and tested on the [Evmos Testnet](https://testnet.mintscan.io/evmos-testnet/proposals/72).

Additionally, the Evmos core team created an End-to-End testing suite that performs the software upgrade locally. These tests have been completed successfully for this upgrade. The instructions on how to run the End-to-End testing suite can be found [here](https://github.com/ramacarlucho/evmos/blob/rama%2Fe2e_clean/tests/e2e/README.md).

Additionally, the upgrade is performed and on testnet with [testnet proposal #66](https://testnet.mintscan.io/evmos-testnet/proposals/66).

result.title: Evmos Software Upgrade v6.0.1
result.plaintext:
Hey everyone! 

The last [Evmos Software Upgrade to `v5.0.0`](https://www.mintscan.io/evmos/proposals/29) did not pass governance, because we noticed on Testnet that the upgrade required some fixes. This is a good example of the importance of testing upgrades in a testnet environment. The main issue that we discovered was that Metamask transactions could not be submitted, because the UI didn't allow large differences between the base fee and the min gas price. 

This thread is following up with scheduling the `v6.0.1` software upgrade on mainnet. Please find below an overview of the proposed changes and the motivation behind them. Please let us know what you think of the upgrade!

## Author

Daniel Burckhardt ([@danburck](https://twitter.com/danburck)), Evmos Core Team

## Software Upgrade being scheduled with this proposal

If successful, this proposal will schedule an Evmos mainnet software upgrade at block height [1,042,000
](https://www.mintscan.io/evmos/blocks/1042000) (Estimated Target Date: Mon Jul 04 2022 19:16:07 GMT+0200 ) from it's current version [v4.1.0](https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/releases/tag/v4.0.1) to [v6.0.1](https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/releases/tag/v6.0.1). This proposal has a voting time of 5 days.

## Motivation

By proposing a scheduled upgrade, we want to implement a smooth and transparent upgrade process, that is first proposed on testnet and then on mainnet. Software upgrades generally aim to improve current performance and add new features to the Evmos chain. For more information on the types of upgrades, please visit our [Software Upgrade Guide](https://docs.evmos.org/validators/upgrades/overview.html).

## Impact

On a high level, the `v6.0.1` software includes the following improvements:

* ERC20 module: Improve coin denomination display and allow coins with `erc20/` names to be sent over IBC
* Improve congestion issues for EVM transactions on Ethermint through the `MinGasPrice` and `MinGasMultiplier` fee market parameters.
* Allow Metamask transactions with min gas price
* Add observability for Evmos and Ethermint modules to measure performance
* Cosmos SDK and IBC dependency updates

Software upgrades also allow changing the state or parameters. The following migrations are included in this upgrade:

* Update Tendermint Consensus Evidence params to prepare to move to a block time of 2 seconds
* Update faulty IBC denomination traces for denominations with `erc20/`
* Resolve Airdrop claims: A few users' tokens are still locked due to issues with the airdrop. By swapping claimed actions we allow the users to migrate the records via IBC if needed or mark the Evm action as completed for the Keplr users who are not able to complete it. Since no actual claiming of action is occurring, the balance will remain unchanged
* Migrates the claims record of a specific early contributor (Blockchain at Berkeley) from one address to another. See the [Rektdrop blog post](https://medium.com/evmos/the-evmos-rektdrop-abbe931ba823) for details about Early Contributors
* Set the `MinGasPrice` param value to `20,000,000,000aevmos` (view [discussion](https://commonwealth.im/evmos/discussion/5073-global-min-gas-price-value-for-cosmos-sdk-and-evm-transaction-choosing-a-value))
* The EVM now only refunds 50% of the leftover gas

A full changelog can be found [here](https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/releases/tag/v6.0.1).

## Testing

The Evmos core team created an End-to-End testing suite that performs the software upgrade locally. These tests have been completed successfully for this upgrade. The instructions on how to run the End-to-End testing suite can be found [here](https://github.com/ramacarlucho/evmos/blob/rama%2Fe2e_clean/tests/e2e/README.md). Additionally, the upgrade is performed and on testnet with [testnet proposal #34](https://testnet.mintscan.io/evmos-testnet/proposals/34).

## Discussion

Before voting, please follow and discuss this proposal using the official [discussion on commonwealth](https://commonwealth.im/evmos/discussion/5922-evmos-software-upgrade-v601).

The last [Evmos Software Upgrade to `v5.0.0`](https://www.mintscan.io/evmos/proposals/29) did not pass governance, because we noticed on Testnet that the upgrade required some fixes. This is a good example of the importance of testing upgrades in a testnet environment. The main issue that we discovered was that Metamask transactions could not be submitted, because the UI didn't allow large differences between the base fee and the min gas price. 

This thread is following up with scheduling the `v6.0.1` software upgrade on mainnet. Please find below an overview of the proposed changes and the motivation behind them. Please let us know what you think of the upgrade!

## Author

Daniel Burckhardt ([@danburck](https://twitter.com/danburck)), Evmos Core Team

## Software Upgrade being scheduled with this proposal

If successful, this proposal will schedule an Evmos mainnet software upgrade at block height [1,042,000
](https://www.mintscan.io/evmos/blocks/1042000) (Estimated Target Date: Mon Jul 04 2022 19:16:07 GMT+0200 ) from it's current version [v4.1.0](https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/releases/tag/v4.0.1) to [v6.0.1](https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/releases/tag/v6.0.1). This proposal has a voting time of 5 days.

## Motivation

By proposing a scheduled upgrade, we want to implement a smooth and transparent upgrade process, that is first proposed on testnet and then on mainnet. Software upgrades generally aim to improve current performance and add new features to the Evmos chain. For more information on the types of upgrades, please visit our [Software Upgrade Guide](https://docs.evmos.org/validators/upgrades/overview.html).

## Impact

On a high level, the `v6.0.1` software includes the following improvements:

* ERC20 module: Improve coin denomination display and allow coins with `erc20/` names to be sent over IBC
* Improve congestion issues for EVM transactions on Ethermint through the `MinGasPrice` and `MinGasMultiplier` fee market parameters.
* Allow Metamask transactions with min gas price
* Add observability for Evmos and Ethermint modules to measure performance
* Cosmos SDK and IBC dependency updates

Software upgrades also allow changing the state or parameters. The following migrations are included in this upgrade:

* Update Tendermint Consensus Evidence params to prepare to move to a block time of 2 seconds
* Update faulty IBC denomination traces for denominations with `erc20/`
* Resolve Airdrop claims: A few users' tokens are still locked due to issues with the airdrop. By swapping claimed actions we allow the users to migrate the records via IBC if needed or mark the Evm action as completed for the Keplr users who are not able to complete it. Since no actual claiming of action is occurring, the balance will remain unchanged
* Migrates the claims record of a specific early contributor (Blockchain at Berkeley) from one address to another. See the [Rektdrop blog post](https://medium.com/evmos/the-evmos-rektdrop-abbe931ba823) for details about Early Contributors
* Set the `MinGasPrice` param value to `25,000,000,000aevmos` (view [discussion](https://commonwealth.im/evmos/discussion/5073-global-min-gas-price-value-for-cosmos-sdk-and-evm-transaction-choosing-a-value))
* The EVM now only refunds 50% of the leftover gas

A full changelog can be found [here](https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/releases/tag/v6.0.1).

result.title: Evmos Software Upgrade v5.0.0
result.plaintext:
Hi! I'm opening up this thread on scheduling the next software upgrade on mainnet. Please find below an overview of the proposed changes and the motivation behind them. Please let us know what you think of the upgrade!

## Author

Daniel Burckhardt ([@danburck](https://twitter.com/danburck)), Evmos Core Team

## Software Upgrade being scheduled with this proposal

If successful, this proposal will schedule an Evmos mainnet software upgrade at block height [837,500](https://www.mintscan.io/evmos/blocks/837500) (around 3pm UTC next Monday) from it's current version [v4.1.0](https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/releases/tag/v4.0.1) to [v5.0.0](https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/releases/tag/v5.0.0). This proposal has a voting time of 5 days.

## Motivation

By proposing a scheduled upgrade, we want to implement a smooth and transparent upgrade process, that is first proposed on testnet and then on mainnet. Software upgrades generally aim to improve current performance and add new features to the Evmos chain. For more information on the types of upgrades, please visit our [Software Upgrade Guide](https://docs.evmos.org/validators/upgrades/overview.html).

## Impact

On a high level, the `v5.0.0` software includes the following improvements:

* ERC20 module: Improve coin denomination display and allow coins with `erc20/` names to be sent over IBC
* Improve congestion issues for EVM transactions on Ethermint through the `MinGasPrice` and `MinGasMultiplier` fee market parameters
* Add observability for Evmos and Ethermint modules to measure performance
* Cosmos SDK and IBC dependency updates

Software upgrades also allow changing the state or parameters. The following migrations are included in this upgrade:

* Update Tendermint Consensus Evidence params to prepare to move to a block time of 2 seconds
* Update faulty IBC denomination traces for denominations with `erc20/`
* Resolve Airdrop claims: A few users' tokens are still locked due to issues with the airdrop. By swapping claimed actions we allow the users to migrate the records via IBC if needed or mark the Evm action as completed for the Keplr users who are not able to complete it. Since no actual claiming of action is occurring, the balance will remain unchanged
* Migrates the claims record of a specific early contributor (Blockchain at Berkeley) from one address to another. See the [Rektdrop blog post](https://medium.com/evmos/the-evmos-rektdrop-abbe931ba823) for details about Early Contributors
* Set the `MinGasPrice` param value to `25,000,000,000aevmos` (view [discussion](https://commonwealth.im/evmos/discussion/5073-global-min-gas-price-value-for-cosmos-sdk-and-evm-transaction-choosing-a-value))
* The EVM now only refunds 50% of the leftover gas

A full changelog can be found [here](https://github.com/tharsis/evmos/releases/tag/v5.0.0).

## Testing

The Evmos core team created an End-to-End testing suite that performs the software upgrade locally. These tests have been completed successfully for this upgrade. The instructions on how to run the End-to-End testing suite can be found [here](https://github.com/ramacarlucho/evmos/blob/rama%2Fe2e_clean/tests/e2e/README.md). Additionally, the upgrade is performed and on testnet with [testnet proposal #34](https://testnet.mintscan.io/evmos-testnet/proposals/34).

## Discussion

Before voting, please follow and discuss this proposal using the official [discussion on commonwealth](https://commonwealth.im/evmos/discussion/5467-evmos-software-upgrade-v500).
